results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers, 


Since the last film was so good, let's watch another film, Istanbul Unveiled,  a travel documentary, from MFA Turkish Film Festival.  

Istanbul Unveiled by Şerif Yenen (2013, 60 min.). A young American woman visits Istanbul, interviewing interesting characters in both popular and counter-cultural settings. The best belly dancer in Turkey, a masseur at a public bath, and one of the richest women in Turkey are among the colorful people she interviews. Her talks with a large cultural cross-section of local people provides a rich and holistic experience of life in Istanbul.

A discussion with the film director will follow the screening.

I strongly recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance. You may purchase your tickets online.  The cost is $9 for members and $11 for non-members.  


The film starts at 3:00 pm, however the meeting time for the group is set for 2:30 pm  pm at the entrance of the Remis Auditorium.  

The plan is to meet at 2:30 pm at the entrance of the auditorium and then  enter the auditorium to sit as a group at 2:45 pm.  I strongly recommend that you come early and join the pre-Meetup gathering for this event at the Taste Cafe. 

The auditorium is located inside the museum on Level 1.  Directly across from the auditorium, there is the Taste Cafe and Wine Bar.  I will schedule a separate event at this cafe for those who would like to meet early, starting at 1:30 pm, to have a snack or a beverage before the film.

Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. For events to be successful, I need to know who to expect and how many.  


This is a public event and you are certainly free to attend this event outside the Meetup group.  I just ask  that only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending this event and intend to meet members of the group.  

If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group.  

As for parking, and directions, I strongly recommend that you take public transportation, the Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Visit these links for more information on getting to the museum and parking: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

I look forward to seeing you at the MFA.

Joana

***Additional Film Information***


To view the trailer, https://vimeo.com/62818595


http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2747548/


<a>http://www.mfa.org/programs/series/the-15th-boston-turkish-film-festival</a>;


http://www.mfa.org/programs/film/istanbul-unveiled

results.description:
We traditionally have a large social meetup twice each month. This gives everyone an opportunity to come and make new friends, practice their Japanese or English, and spend time with a bunch of interesting people from around the Boston area and overseas.  This meetup may be cancelled if there are very few RSVPs.

Close to Boylston on the Green Line, or Chinatown on the Orange Line.
Also a short walk from Park Street or Downtown Crossing. 

• From Boylston Station, go south on Tremont Street (away from Boston Common),  then take a right onto Stuart Street.  The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

• From Chinatown Station, go west on Boylston Street (toward Boston Common), then take a left onto Tremont Street. Turn right onto Stuart Street. The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

There is a map of the area below. If you have trouble finding us, please feel free to call or text me at[masked]-2923.  Also you can call or text if you come after we have left for Chinatown, although then there is a greater chance I will miss the call.

Come on by, relax, practice in either language of your choice, and enjoy being part of our growing community!

The Meetup does not end at 6 - instead, some time around there, we usually go out to Chinatown for dinner afterwards to eat family style - anyone who wants to come is welcome. The cost is usually around $12-20/person (not including any drinks for which people pay their own way).  We are open to restaurant suggestions.  However, I am not willing to get into dividing up large numbers of orders on one giant check, which is why we generally go to Chinatown and split everything down the middle.  If you don't want to eat at all, you can come and just enjoy the company for free.  

Please BRING CASH if you can and want to go to dinner - many of the restaurants limit cards to two per table, so if a lot of people have no cash it can be a problem.

Stuart Street view

Hi everyone! We've heard some feedback from members that there's interest for a regular Bible study. Deb has talked to the Board at First Calvary and they've agreed to let us use their facilities each week for our Bible studies!

We're only a few weeks away from the time of year that commemorates Christ's sacrifice and resurrection for our salvation. The study for April 2nd will be on the meaning of Christ's sacrifice and what salvation means to us. We'll also sing some praise and worship songs, so please bring along an instrument if you'd like to play along!

Future Bible studies would be bi-weekly on the 1st and 3rd Saturday's each month, at the same time and location, with the topics determined by you! We'll also be scheduling separate bi-weekly Bible studies for the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of each month with topics relevant to being a single Christian in today's world, with topics again determined by you!


You're always welcome to come to any Bible Studies that fit your schedule. The studies will be structured as independent sessions, so you won't be lost if you miss one!

I hope you can join us!

results.description:
If you have never participated in an Intimate Puja Circle or are new to Tantra this is for YOU!  

** When you register, please mention Pleasure Without Borders Boston **


_________________________________


The Level 1 Intimate Puja Circle</a> is for you if you are ready for: 

• A community dedicated to deep intimacy, divine connection, laughter and play

• Healing intimacy and issues related to relationship 

• Honoring boundaries, finding your yes/no, and conscious communication

• A gentle introduction to Tantra and intimacy 

• Play, laughter, and fun! 

___________________________________


A <a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=D3HF36UHEDBJY">Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  

_________________________________________ 

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn Vogel, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience "Tantric Speed Dating" as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

______________________________

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"></a> itself will begin part-way through during which you'll have the chance to connect with others (one-on-one) -- this part  will be facilitated, with a structure provided. You will be encouraged to practice and learn the following: 

• Honoring your own boundaries 

• Honoring others' boundaries

• What it means to provide consent 

• Finding your 'yes' and your 'no' and speaking them aloud

• Touch with permission only 

• The energetics of intimacy that provide balance in connection 

You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want. 

________________________________

Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  In fact, this event teaches relationship skills that are vital for a creating a juicy, harmonious, long term connection. Come alone or bring your partner.  

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist.  I don't recommend you wear skirts, dresses, or kilts. 

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS, your partner, your present self!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

results.description:
Hi everyone! We're only a few weeks away from the time of year that commemorates Christ's sacrifice and resurrection for our salvation. We are blessed at this time to have a new facility for our bible studies and are excited to resume studying God's word together!

The study for this week will be on the meaning of Christ's sacrifice and what salvation means to us. 

Future Bible studies would be bi-weekly on the 1st and 3rd Saturday's each month, at the same time and location, with the topics determined by you! We'll also be scheduling separate bi-weekly Bible studies for the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of each month around dating, marriage and family life.

You're always welcome to come to any Bible Studies that fit your schedule. The studies will be structured as independent sessions, so you won't be lost if you miss one!

I hope you can join us!
results.name: 1st & 3rd Saturday Bible Study:  "John 3:16, What does it mean to be saved?"

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn Vogel, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience "Tantric Speed Dating" as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

• The energetics of intimacy that provide balance in connection

results.description:
All,

Here we are with yet another conscious movie night. This time we plan to watch the movie together as a group in a theater.

We plan to get to Apple Cinema around 5.45 pm that way we could meet before going in together as a group. I shall be meeting everyone outside the main entrance.

We all buy our own tickets for the 6:00 pm show. After the movie we plan to go to 'Panera Breads' next door to grab a bit and have a short facilitated discussion for people to talk about what they got from the movie and how it affects or inspires them

==============

Storyline:

MIRACLES FROM HEAVEN is based on the incredible true story of the Beam family. When Christy (Jennifer Garner) discovers her 10-year-old daughter Anna (Kylie Rogers) has a rare, incurable disease, she becomes a ferocious advocate for her daughter's healing as she searches for a solution. After Anna has a freak accident, an extraordinary miracle unfolds in the wake of her dramatic rescue that leaves medical specialists mystified, her family restored and their community inspired.

Trailer: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4257926/

Showtime: 6:00 PM
results.name: Conscious Movie Night:- "Miracles from Heaven"

Unlike our usual push to participate, this event is purely for fun: Sit back and enjoy.
Area clubs will be meeting at Lesley College this Saturday night for a speech contest: It will feature both prepared speeches (the winners from clubs in surrounding towns) as well as a "Think on your Feet" contest [Contestants are given a topic, and they speak about it for two minutes]. If you've never attended one, it's a cross between The Moth storytelling hour on NPR, and TEDx. I'd really urge you to attend - they're always a lot of fun and entertaining.
The contest runs a couple of hours.

Like all Toastmaster activities, this one is run by volunteers, and they need help to make it all go smoothly.
If you are able to participate, PLEASE contact Jesse Welty at [masked]
....................................................
Lesley Univ - University Hall Bldg
Auditorium (Rm 150) on the 2nd floor. Look for signs. Parking: If you can't find street parking (Beware - Metered until 8 PM !), There is parking to the rear of the bldg. You will present ticket to the security desk on your way out ($3), then insert the ticket at the gate as you exit.
(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)

results.description:
Please join the BOS PDC class at the Boston Nature Center for this special presentation and discussion led by our friends from Offshoots Productive Landscapes on the vital topic of phytoremediation, or using plants to help clean up contaminated soils.


This event is for anyone who is interested in growing food in urban soils, learning about options for earth repair using plants, or working with any site that might have contamination.  How can plants help and when might they NOT be the right choice for remediation work?

Offshoots, Inc. principle Kate Kennen is the author of the recently published Phyto, a compendium of information about phytoremediation.  Kate will be accompanied by Joe Shafner, also of Offshoots, and a 2013 PDC graduate.

The session will cover:

• basic concepts / fundamentals of phytotechnologies

• typical contaminants found in the built environment

• current case studies

• advantages and limitations of plant-based cleanups

Here is a recent interview with Kate: http://www.pressherald.com/2016/03/13/maine-gardener-wield-the-power-of-plants-to-prevent-pollution/

There is a $2-3 suggested donation at the door.  No one turned away for lack of funds.

Kate Kennen - RLA, Owner

</a>Having spent her childhood at her family’s garden center in central Massachusetts, Kate is well versed in the plants and ecological systems of the Northeast. A registered Landscape Architect with degrees from Cornell University and Harvard’s Graduate School of Design, she founded Kennen Landscape Architecture in 2004 and Offshoots, Inc in 2012 to create practices focused on productive planting and ecological planning. Previously, Kate was an associate at Design Workshop in Aspen, Colorado. Kate has been honored with numerous awards for her recent and ongoing projects including Cape Cod’s Downtown Hyannis Revitalization Project, Plantworks at 725 Main Street, a phytoremediation installation on a former gas station site, and Bouyed Coasts, an environmental art installation project in Barnstable Massachusetts. Her current research and teaching concentrates on planting design and applied phytotechnologies that utilize plants to clean up contaminated sites. She currently teaches a research seminar in Phytotechnologies for Landscape Design at the Harvard University Graduate School of Design. She is co-authoring a book with Niall Kirkwood, Phyto: Principles for Site Remediation and Landscape Design, which will be published by Routledge in 2015. <a href="http://offshootsinc.com/wpress/wp-content/uploads/KKennen-Resume-Offshoots.pdf">View Resume.


Joe Shafner - Director of Landscape Operations

<a href="http://offshootsinc.com/wpress/wp-content/uploads/joe.jpg"></a>Joe graduated from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst with a Bachelor of Landscape Architecture. He is a Massachusetts Certified Landscape Professional [MCLP #1626], an Accredited Organic Land Care Professional [AOLCP] with the New England Organic Farming Association [NOFA], earned a Permaculture Design Certificate [PDC] through the Maine Organic Farmers and Gardeners Association and has worked in the nursery business and landscape design and construction fields for over a decade. Having been involved with all sides of the industry, Joe has extensive knowledge of plants, design and installation, thereby ensuring successful collaborations with clients, designers and trade professionals. As a Project Manager with Offshoots, Joe assists in the design of new projects and oversees installations. He strives to create symbiotic relationships between clients, landscape and natural ecologies.
results.name: Phytoremediation: Using Plants to Heal the Soil w/Guests from Offshoots Inc.

results.description:
Located in central Italy along the Tyrrhenian coast, Tuscany is home to some of the world's most notable wine regions. The grape Sangiovese is king in Tuscany. Sangiovese has different clones that make Chianti Classico, Vino Nobile di Montalepulciano and Brunello di Montalcino.

In the 1970s a new class of wines known in the trade as Super Tuscans emerged. These wines were made outside DOC/DOCG regulations but were considered of high quality and commanded high prices. Many of these wines became cult wines.

Some people define Super Tuscan wine as a Tuscan blend made with Cabernet Sauvignon or other international varieties. Others define it as any expensive wine from Tuscany.

The truth is the Super Tuscan is all those things—and none of those things. A Super Tuscan can be a 100 percent expression of Sangiovese with absolutely no international varieties. It can be a DOC wine, and in fact many are, and it can span any price point from $12 to $275.

Our tour will bring us to three regions of Tuscany and give us the opportunity to compare eight wines from these regions. You will be brought to the village of Montalcino where Brunello is the name of the local Sangiovese variety that is grown. Located south of the Chianti Classico zone, the Montalcino range is drier and warmer than Chianti.

Your next stop will be in the central region of Tuscany where the Chianti zone is located. Chianti is Tuscany's largest classified wine region and produces over eight million cases a year.

Your tour will continue on to the Bolgheri region located on the Tuscan coast just south of Livorno and is one of Italy's most prestigious vineyard areas. Its winemaking zone is made up of sloping coastal vineyards and due to the particular characteristics of the soil and micro climate, the grape varieties of Bordeaux origin tend to thrive, such as Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot.

Your wines have been carefully selected for you to have the best comparative experience possible and will be provided for you. Please bring $20 cash to contribute to your share of the wines, 4 glasses and a food item to share.
Can't wait to share this showcase of the Tuscany region with you!!
results.name: Tuscan Wine Tour

results.description:
Hello Friends and Spiritual Seekers,


Better World Meditation is hosting a heart filled  celebration of Meditation Music and a Mindful Party.Center in Arlington, MA. Our purpose is to "Create A Better World Through Spiritual Practice".  The performers are: Steven Kriger, the Founder of Better World Meditation and Kim Zunner.

Steven Kriger is an energetic and compassionate singer/songwriter. He expresses what he feels in his heart through his songs. Steven performs a nice blend of both original and cover songs focusing on World Peace and spirituality as well as some chants from the Yogic/tradition. Steven has performed in many coffeehouses, churches, and other venues for over 30 years.

Kim Zunner's relatable lyrics and inspired, soulful sounds"ooze heart," Kim's music is an expression of being both of this world, and of the Divine. She looks to connect with her audience and reach people where it really matters. Kim enjoys playing coffee shops, restaurants, and yoga studios where folks can relax, enjoy, and connect to something deeper within themselves. 

Please note that this event is being advertised on 3 meetup pages. We also have people attending who are not Members of Meetup.com.

The evening schedule is as follows:

For those who want to eat beforehand, I'll be across the street at the Student Center cafeteria at 6:30. Then we'll meet up with more people outside the entrance to the movie hall at 7:30 before heading in around 7:45. 

If you've never seen this movie before, you're in for a comedy classic! Here's the info:

Airplane! (1980)April 1, 2016 at 8:00 pm in 26-100
April 2, 2016 at 8:00 pm in 26-100
</a>FREE admission and popcorn, sponsored by the <a href="http://shass.mit.edu/funny">de Florez Fund for Humor!

Airport series of disaster movies relies on ridiculous sight gags, groan-inducing dialogue, and deadpan acting -- a comedy style that would be imitated for the next 20 years. Airplane! pulls out all the clichés as alcoholic pilot Ted Striker (Robert Hays), who's developed a fear of flying due to wartime trauma, boards a jumbo jet in an attempt to woo back his stewardess girlfriend (Julie Hagerty). Food poisoning decimates the passengers and crew, leaving it up to Striker to land the plane, with the help of a glue-sniffing air traffic controller (Lloyd Bridges) and Striker's vengeful former captain (Robert Stack), who must both talk him down. Along the way, we meet a clutch of stock disaster movie passengers like the guitar-strumming nun, a sick little girl, a frightened old lady, and two African-American travelers whose "jive" has to be subtitled. Leslie Nielsen portrays the plane's doctor, launching a new phase of the actor's career that carried him through the next two decades in several similarly comedic roles. [www.allmovie.com>

Airplane! is a splendidly tacky, totally tasteless, completely insignificant flight, a gooney bird of a movie that looks as if it could never get off the ground and then surprises and delights with its free-spirited aerobatics. 
      -- Richard Schickel, Time Magazine. Read this review.

results.description:
Hello Friends and Spiritual Seekers,

We are having a heart filled  celebration of Healing Meditation , Spiritually Awakening Concert and a Mindful Party,. The event is sponsored by Better World Meditation whose mission is to "Create A Better World Through Spiritual Practice". The meditation and opening performance will be with Steven Kriger, the founder of the organization. Following, we be our feature performance with singer/songwriter Kim Zunner.

Kim Zunner is a spirited singer songwriter and music therapist .  With relatable lyrics and inspired, soulful sounds that "ooze heart," Kim's music is an expression of being both of this world, and of the Divine. She looks to connect with her audience and reach people where it really matters. Kim enjoys playing coffee shops, restaurants, and yoga studios where folks can relax, enjoy, and connect to something deeper within themselves.


Steven Kriger is an energetic and compassionate singer/songwriter. He expresses what he feels in his heart through his songs. Steven performs a nice blend of both original and cover songs along with Yogic chants focusing on World Peace and spirituality with a catchy sense of humor. Steven has performed in many coffeehouses, churches, and other venues for over 30 years.

results.description:
Greetings one and all! Welcome to our latest fundraising night! 

For those of you who haven’t been to one of these before, this is a fundraising event designed to help cover the costs of the website and supplement future events. While successful in the past, we were unable to obtain the space to host another one last fall, putting us behind our overall goals. There are plans behind the scenes for bigger and better events, but before we can make that a reality, more progress needs to be made.

However, to reiterate a point, there is NO COST for coming to this event.

RSVPing will be completely free!

Instead, we will be doing the following!

First, requesting a small, optional, donation from any attendees to offset the associated expenses. The venue and equipment is not free, so every little bit helps! 

Secondly, running a raffle with all sorts of goodies! Word will be put out to the group for donations shortly.

As an added incentive, after prior testing, any person who donates will receive five raffle tickets to use as they see fit! Details to follow!

Now, for those of you who have never heard about the title, here is a summary of Patema Inverted :)

From the director of Time of Eve comes a perspective-twisting anime adventure about two people separated by opposite gravities. Together they set out to discover the secret that keeps their worlds apart.

Please come out and show your support!

NOTE: TO ANY NON-MEMBERS CHECKING THIS EVENT OUT

RSVPing is completely free. However, if you want to check out the event without joining the group to start, we will have a waiting list that you can walk in and sign up for the night of the viewing. This is only intended to track the number of people in the event, given the limited space. Anyone who signs up ahead of time will AUTOMATICALLY be added to said sign up sheet.
results.name: Japanese Anime and Films Fundraising Presents: Patema Inverted!

results.description:
I recently was introduced to Blue Heron. The last concert was SOLD OUT at Old South. I'm the host for this event. Who's in?

Facebook event page, where you can purchase tickets.  For this meetup I recommend "General Admission" section for $10-$30 (students, seniors, adult)


https://www.facebook.com/events/263964600601413/

(NB: Doors and box office open at 7:00 PM / Pre-concert talk begins at 7:15 PM)

Award-winning ensemble Blue Heron joins forces with the stellar wind band Dark Horse Consort for a festive program of sacred and secular music from 16th-century Seville, including music of Peñalosa, Guerrero, Morales, Lobo and Vivanco.


The concert will offer a panoramic view of Spanish music from the mid-fifteenth century up through the first decade of the seventeenth. The first half presents a small sample of the riches of Spanish song from the turn of the 16th century, with music from two famous songbooks, the Cancionero de Palacio and the Cancionero de la Colombina. The second half offers a focus on sacred works (by Cristóbal de Morales, Francisco Guerrero and Alonso Lobo); the proceedings will conclude in grand style with a performance of Sebastián de Vivanco’s glorious Magnificat sexti toni sex vocibus, with instrumental interpolations attributed to Philippe Rogier.

Seville's wealth (derived from its port’s monopoly on trade with the Empire’s overseas dominions) stimulated a Golden Age in the arts. Many of the greatest Spanish composers of the century were associated with the city and its cathedral, including Francisco de Peñalosa, Cristóbal de Morales, Francisco Guerrero, and Alonso Lobo; Guerrero spent most of his life and career in the city and carefully nurtured the cathedral’s wind band, which was established in 1526 — possibly the first in Europe. The program features music of these masters and more and will present sonorous sacred works, delightful dances, and secular songs performed by an ensemble of six singers and six instrumentalists wielding cornetts, shawms, sackbuts, and recorders.

Doors and box office open at 7:00 PM / Pre-concert talk begins at 7:15 PM

Pre-concert talk by Michael Noone (Boston College).

Blue Heron
Michael Barrett, Paul Guttry, Jason McStoots, Martin Near, Margot Rood, Mark Sprinkle, voices
Scott Metcalfe, director

Dark Horse Consort
Kiri Tollaksen & Alexandra Opsahl, cornettos
Priscilla Herreid, shawm & dulcian
Greg Ingles, Erik Schmalz & Mack Ramsey, sackbuts

results.description:
The lead guitarist hauls, playing the axe behind his head. A no nonsense rockin NH band!  Great food, atmosphere, and music! Cool, a cover band actually has a site. 


       Bad Medicine is a versatile rock cover band from southern New Hampshire.  We are not a Bon Jovi tribute band, but we do cover that band.  In the early '80's, Larry and Phil sought to put a band together who would attract lots of different types of audiences (people with many different tastes in rock music). We are a cover band who prides itself on working with all clients to make each show a memorable and profitable experience.

    The band has a combined experience of over 100 years and has many great memories...many of which we continue to build.  We bring you great music with a new line-up.  Get your eyes and ears ready and put on your dancin' shoes.  YOU'RE GOING TO GET A WICKED DOSE OF BAD MEDICINE!

RUBIX KUBE is taking the universe by storm as the most original ‘80s tribute band of all time. Our one-of-a-kind “THE EIGHTIES STRIKE BACK Show” is performed in our NYC headquarters, across the planet, and to galaxies far . . far away. The KUBE is more than just a cover band - it's a totally awesome, true '80s Experience! Every super-charged show takes it to the max and guarantees to set the roof on fire and burn down the house. (Metaphorically speaking of course).

RUBIX KUBE is led by a male and female dynamic duo of karma chameleons, able to transform in the-blink-of-an-eye into the voice and character of any '80s icon. Madonna, Michael Jackson, Cher, Prince, Devo, Bon Jovi, Guns N’ Roses, and more teleport right before your eyes on the same stage, in one concert! Their supporting sidekicks are some of the most-excellent and versatile musicians around. All are decked out in vibrant, vintage '80s threads and with enough hairspray to take down Freddy Krueger, The Terminator, Beetlejuice, and all The Gremlins at once. The KUBE is able to crank out Pop, Rock, New Wave, Dance and Hair Metal hits from the decade of decadence, and perform them just like the originals - yet with their own gnarly twist.

Talkshow host Kelly Ripa has praised RUBIX KUBE as "Amazing. You definitely have to check it out, it's so much fun. It's like going back to The Eighties!"

Audiences of all ages . . prepare for the most bodacious, totally rad and ultimate time-warp back to The Eighties with RUBIX KUBE!!
results.name: Rubix Kube: The Ultimate '80s Tribute Band/ FOXBORO

April! So nice to see you again! What a time to be alive a celebrate Spring then with Boston A-List's Best Night of Comedy, THE MENDOZA LINE!

This and every Saturday night live from the back room of the The Dugout Cafe (722 Comm Ave), John Baglio, Julia Claire, and Zach "Zack" Armentrout bring you a different lineup stacked with the biggest, baddest, and bestiest comedians from Boston and beyond. And guess what? Its only FIVE DOLLARS! With drink specials as far as the eye can see and free popcorn, this intimate atmosphere is the perfect place to take in some meaningful and quality laughs!

Here's the link to buy your tickets now to guarantee a seat as room is limited. Our shows have frequently sold out, and we'd hate to break your little heart and turn you away: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-15228587114

Zachary Brazao (US Postal Service)

Hailing from Rotterdam, the Netherlands, Ferry Corsten’s lustrous career is exemplified by a passion for music that began as a hobby and spiralled into a full-blown profession. Today, as it was in the beginning, Corsten’s skills lie in his ability to coax the maximum emotional impact from electronic dance music of all genres, not just trance, but also progressive-house and electro. He remains and has always been ahead-of-his time, making music that becomes a template for others to follow.

Music: soundcloud.com/ferry-corsten

Price: $25, Pay in Advance or more at the door. 

Dress: No shorts / hats / oversized baggy jeans / hoodies / boots / athletic wear

results.description:
This is a 5 mile loop around Hickory Hills Forest and Lunenburg conservation land. It takes approx 2 hours.   It is a nice hike mostly on Cart paths with rolling hills mixed in.. We will meet at 156 S. Row Road, in Lunenburg. Walk over to the trail head and make our way around the forest. Wear sturdy shoes or boots, sneakers are not recommended.  We do encounter streams, wet leaves and rocks, from time to time,. We will not leave anyone behind.  Socially behaved dogs are welcome, please bring your own doggie bags. 

NEW !!!!!! PLEASE TAKE NOTE: The time has changed and sneakers are not recommended.
Directions.
From the center of Lunenburg
Rte 2A East Approx 3/4 mile turn left onto Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx 1/2 mile on Townsend Harbor Road to the stop sign. Turn left at the stop sign to continue on Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx another 1/2 mile at the fork stay left onto South Row Road. Follow South Row Road for approx 1/2 mile.
My house is on the right.
Uturn Driveway, Brown house. Pull right into the driveway.

We meet for 9:00 and try to take off promptly.  

IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, PLEASE CHANGE YOUR RSVP!

Thank you, I look forward to another successful hike.
results.name: Trail Hiking, Rolling terrrain

Meet to paint the model for a five week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $75 or $90 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

Please Join L.L. Bean Mansfield for our spring hike in Borderland State Park!   The hike will follow well established marked trails through the state park. It’s a relatively flat hike with no appreciable hills. Numerous glacial formations dot the area.  Leashed, well socialized, people friendly dogs are welcome in this state park. This hike will run over 3 hours and cover over 5 miles in distance. We will meet in the left most parking lot adjacent to the park headquarters. There is a $5 parking fee at Borderland State Park.

Please dress appropriately for the weather conditions.
Dressing in layers works best.
Wear appropriate footwear for hiking.
Please bring water, snacks and any personal medicines and gear you may need as well. A camera and/or binoculars are always a welcome addition.


If you have any trouble finding our meetup location please feel free to call before the event kicks off. Andy’s cell phone is[masked]-4503.
Look for Andy’s Green Honda Pilot with the “L.L. Bean Mansfield Outing Program” banner on the side! Please arrive by 9:45AM so we can get going on time.

Note: This meetup will always show as "full" with only one person attending (the organizer). This is to ensure we don't have competing registration lists (one Meetup, one LLBean). Just go to www.llbean.com/mansfield and sign up! See you there!

Granite Links is the place to be on April 3rd when the Chapter kicks off the 2016 season. Come hear about the Chapter's leagues and events planned for 2016, while enjoying a delicious brunch buffet. In addition, several vendors will be onsite with their fabulous golf and non-golf items and Jane Frost will be the guest speaker, sharing her golf insights that could improve your golf game. Plus, let's not forget about the fabulous prizes and great merchandise that bring many of attendees back year after year. And, bring a friend to introduce her to the EWGA and the Boston Chapter's fun times.

Non Members: come see what the EWGA has to offer and the benefits of joining the Boston Chapter. Whether you are an experienced golfer or a beginner, a scratch golfer or a "time to pick up the ball and move onto the next hole" golfer, the Boston Chapter offers many leagues, weekend events, competitive tournaments, special events, and educational/training programs with the goal of having something for every player.

results.description:
Every Sunday at 10:30 AM we gather in our Sunday Circle, a time for gratitude,  prayer, song, and reflection.  Anyone is welcome to simply come as you are to any of these gatherings.  Please join us if you are seeking a time of centering, transformation, and connection with other people on their spiritual journeys. 

In the Sunday Circles we embody a rootedness in a Christian faith that is open to all faiths.  Our minister, Rev. Dr. Ian Mevorach, often preaches a dialogue sermon that invites the insights and wisdom of all who are gathered.   Other ministers, members of the community, or special guests also take turns leading our circles. Themes of spirituality, social and environmental justice, openness and love are at the core. We often engage in interfaith dialogue. We discuss scriptures from the Bible and other sacred texts, as well as explore poetry, music, and other sources of inspiration.  Every first Sunday of the month we celebrate an inclusive communion that is open to all.

Ou Sunday Circles are a time and place where people come together in a sacred way and where various threads in our community are often woven together into a greater whole.
results.how_to_find_us: Our building is located on Common Street overlooking the town green in Natick Center.  Parking in side and back lots.

results.description:
This event has been postponed until a later date due to weather.

Rolling hills and rocky shorelines offer sweeping views of the Boston skyline, while tree-lined carriage paths designed by famed landscape architect Frederick Law Olmsted make delightful walking trails.

What makes World’s End a special place?
We think it’s the tree-lined carriage paths and sweeping views of the Boston skyline, only 15 miles away. The 251-acre coastscape includes rocky shores, broad hillsides, and open fields bracketed by pockets of woodlands. The property is ideal for walking, picnicking, jogging, horseback riding, cross-country skiing, or simply enjoying nature and the outdoors.

The retreating glacier helped create the geology of Boston Harbor, including the islands and the four spoon-shaped hills (called drumlins) that comprise World’s End. This landscape also features saltwater marshes, meadows, woodlands, and granite ledges covered with red cedars and blueberry thickets. 

http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/south-shore/worlds-end.html

http://www.massvacation.com/business/4593/

*A carpool from chestnut hill square parking garage, 5th floor will leave at 9:30 a.m. Please indicate in the comment section if you would like to carpool

results.description:
Zadie Smith spent 2002 -2003 in Cambridge, MA as a Radcliffe Fellow.  Out of this incubation came "On Beauty."   We think you might like it because it is mighty clever, hilarious, and insightful, and it is set in our fair city and environs.

It is a comic dissection of the multi-racial, multi-cultural weave from family, academic, pop culture dynamics, and conflicting liberal and conservative characters and outlooks.


The Guardian's Review called it ambitious and hugely impressive...  "the plot of Forster's Howards End, ingeniously re-engineered, underpins much of the storyline of On Beauty."


The New York Times Review: " 'On Beauty' is that rare comic novel about the divisive cultural politics of the new century likely to amuse readers on the right as much as those on the left. (Not that they'll necessarily be laughing in the same places.)"
results.name: On Beauty by Zadie Smith

results.description:
Come join us at our regular Scrabble Meetup, and play over lunch or a pastry and some coffee!

We meet twice a month, every month, on the first and third Sunday. Please bring a board if you have one. We have a few spares, so you are welcome to come even if you forget your board.

Newcomers are always welcome. We keep 2 and 3 letter "cheat sheets" for new folks to keep the playing field more even.

We mostly play Scrabble one-on-one, and pairing is random. If you would like to be matched up to someone of a similar skill, just let the organizer know.

Au Bon Pain is right next to the Davis Square T stop, and there is typically ample free street parking on Sundays.  A few times a year, there is a race in Davis Square that shuts down some streets, so keep an eye out for that. If possible I will send out a message to the group the day before.

$2/Meetup goes to help pay for the annual Meetup.com dues and miscellaneous photocopying, but if you are a regular $15/year will be easier for you and me to keep track of!

results.description:
There are literally THOUSANDS of different diet books for sale today. Some claim fast and furious weight loss, some claim to manage diseases or conditions.

Every point of view comes with studies, experiments and logic that support their case. Almost everything seems to make sense, even the opposing theories!

How do you know who to believe?


I can help you sort it out. It's not nearly as overwhelming as it can seem.

Let's get together and talk about what we, as human animals, really ought to be eating - and not eating!

Every single person has the same basic requirements but also slight individual differences so every persons diet will vary slightly. This has to do with a number of factors such as ethnicity, environment, maternal in take and environment while you were still inutero, childhood diet, DNA, family history, stress level and more. 

You'll learn what your body really needs to prevent or reverse disease and how to fine tune your diet for your specific needs!

If you have any specific questions or topics you'd like to cover, message me so I can be sure to have the material and time ready for you!


Make sure to bring a pen and paper!
results.name: How to Feed a Human

An afternoon of Fashion Runway, Food, Wine & Craft Beer Tastings.  Shopping. Raffle. Cash Bar

Chefs Table Foundation, an established 501(c)3 non-profit organization, believes that no aspiring chef should be deprived of fulfilling their dream of receiving a culinary education because of their living and financial situations. Careers in the culinary arts are expected to increase by 5% through 2022. In the United States, the food and beverage industry is the second largest private sector employer and in 2014 there were an estimated 2.1 million cooking jobs available in the United States. The Chefs Table Foundation believes that this upward trend within the industry matched with eager, passionate and educated chefs is a recipe for success! In 2016, their goal is to award a minimum of two candidates with a fully paid scholarship for culinary education.

Date: Sunday, April 3rd, 2016
Time: 12pm-3pm; fashion show at 12:30pm
Place: Irish Social Club, 119 Park Street, West Roxbury, MA 02132
Benefits: Chefs Table Foundation: to provide a culinary education to homeless U.S veterans and underprivileged youths.
Cost: $20 per person; $10 for 17 and under.

The afternoon will feature a runway fashion show, shopping, a raffle, wine, craft beer and food tasting.

Guests scheduled to attend include Chris King, Veteran Employment, MA. Dept. of Veterans’ Services, Boston City Councilors Tim McCarthy,  Matt O’Malley and Annissa Essaibi-George will serve as models.  John Tobin, VP of City & Community Affairs for Northeastern University will emcee the event.

Fabutique, West Roxbury’s first women’s stylish clothing boutique will provide the clothing for local Parkway models. lululemon athletica of Legacy Place will style the male models.  Handful of the models served in the U.S military.

results.description:
Want to learn Vietnamese? The Vietnamese class for adults will be on Sundays from 12:30pm to 2:30pm at VietAID Center, 42 Charles Street, Dorchester, second floor. This is the Charles St in Dorchester, near Fields Corner T Stop on the Red Line, not Charles St, Boston. There is also a small parking lot.

This school year has 3 trimesters of about 10 weeks each (not including holiday weekends). This is the 3rd trimester. Students can sign up for 1, 2, or hopefully all 3. Fee for this trimester is $40 and you pay as you go for the trimester(s) that you take. The fee helps pay for space rental, books, printings, snacks, and other miscellaneous items that will be purchased for the class. The teacher is southern Vietnamese but he will teach in the northern dialect. The southern pronounce certain letters (d, g, v) the same, which makes it more difficult to learn to read.

There is no homework and no tests, only practice and recitation.

SCHEDULE

04/03/16 1 - Grammar 7, Romance
04/10/16 2 - B1:L11. Housing/ Lodging
04/17/16 3 - B1:L12. Health/ Seeking Help
04/24/16 4 - B1:L13. Education
05/01/16 5 - B1:L14. Sports
05/08/16 6 - B1:L15. Grammar 8, Recreation & Hobbies
05/15/16 7 - B1:L16. Transportation and Directions
05/22/16 9 - End of Year Party (join other classes 10am)
05/22/16 10 - FINAL REVIEW

results.description:
Please join us for a pleasant afternoon of competitive party bridge.

Bertucci's has its own parking lot, a welcoming atmosphere, and hearty food (including all-you-can-eat salads and soups).

Please sign up by Saturday afternoon, the day before the game. If at least 5 players have not registered by then, the game will have to be cancelled for that week.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play. No formal training will be offered, but this is a social, casual event, and bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed at any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.

results.description:
The cast of the brand new production of THE SOUND OF MUSIC, directed by three-time Tony Award winner Jack O'Brien, which will soon hit the road, has just met the press - and BroadwayWorld was on hand. Below, go inide the rehearsal room with Ashley Brown, Ben Davis, Kerstin Anderson and more!  Kerstin is Kathy K's daughter.

Here is a sneak peak of what we are going to see very soon.  I know Kathy K is so very proud of her daughter Kerstin.   A "STAR" is born!!!  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmJWGJtakAY

We, as a Dynamic family, want to share this moment with Kathy.  Many of us met Kerstin when we went ziplining.  The beautiful, quiet and demure blonde that came with Kathy.  She has a voice that is unlike any you've heard.  Watch the clip for a preview.

This lavish new production launches this September at the Ahmanson Theatre in Los Angeles, under the auspices of the Center Theatre Group, and will then tour North America for multiple seasons, playing multi-week and week-long engagements. 

BEN DAVIS (Broadway's Violet, A Little Night Music, La Bohème) will play Captain Georg von Trapp and ASHLEY BROWN (Broadway's Mary Poppins, NBC's The Sound of Music) will play The Mother Abbess with MERWIN FOARD as Max Detweiler, TERI HANSEN as Elsa Schraeder, DAN TRACY as Rolf and PAIGE SILVESTER as Liesl. The von Trapp children will be played by ERICH SCHUETT (Friedrich), MARIA KNASEL (Louisa), QUINN ERICKSON (Kurt), SVEA JOHNSON (Brigitta), MACKENZIE CURRIE (Marta) and AUDREY BENNETT (Gretl). And introducing Jack O'Brien's brand new discovery, KERSTIN ANDERSON as Maria Rainer. A current student at Pace University, Ms. Anderson won the coveted role from hundreds who auditioned. This will be her first national tour.

https://youtu.be/BN-hOpoLKuI

The hills are alive! A brand new production of The Sound of Music, directed by Jack O’Brien, is coming to you. The spirited, romantic and beloved musical story of Maria and the Von Trapp Family will once again thrill audiences with its Tony, Grammy and Academy Award-winning Best Score, including “My Favorite Things,” “Do-Re-Mi,” “Climb Ev’ry Mountain,” “Edelweiss” and the title song.

“We plan to look more closely at this remarkable work—to tear off the varnish of the past and reveal one of the great, fresh glories of musical theater,” says three-time Tony Award-winning Director Jack O’Brien.

The Sound of Music features music by Richard Rodgers, lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II, book by Howard Lindsay and Russel Crouse, suggested by “The Trapp Family Singers” by Maria Augusta Trapp.

The Sound of Music enjoyed extraordinary success as the first live television production of a musical in over 50 years when “The Sound of Music Live!” aired on NBC in December, 2013 (seen by over 44 million people); 2015 marks the 50th anniversary of the film version, which continues to be the most successful movie musical in history.

http://www.theatermania.com/video/the-team-behind-the-sound-of-music-national-tour-o_845.html

results.description:
Five authors, bloggers, and their publishers, have been brutally attacked and murdered for expressing their rational views in Bangladesh in 2015. Writer, blogger and activist Rafida Ahmed, who was herself savagely attacked as her husband Dr. Avijit Roy was murdered, will reflect on issues associated with these murders within the wider context of history of free
thinking and the recent rise of religious fundamentalism. ***

Ms. Ahmed grew up in Bangladesh and later moved to Canada and the US for higher education. Dr. Roy and Ms. Ahmed were brutally attacked in the middle of the street by religious fundamentalists during a book signing trip to Dhaka, Bangladesh on February 26, 2015. Dr. Roy was hacked to death, and Ms. Ahmed was gravely injured during the attack. Since the attack, the same fundamentalist terrorist group has killed 3 other bloggers and a publisher for publishing Avijit’s books on science, philosophy, rationalism and freethinking. They also stabbed another publisher and 2 other writers last year. These gruesome attacks were meant to destroy the freethinking movement in Bangladesh. But the secular movement in Bangladesh and the Mukto Mona community are more determined now than ever to secure free speech and keep Mr. Roy’s dream alive.
results.name: Rafida Ahmed: Can Machetes Kill Us?

results.description:
Have you ever tried to make change and then found yourself falling back again into old patterns?  

Does the fear of not being good enough, or losing what you have, or not knowing what comes next stop you in your tracks? 

Then you're running into resistances!

Resistances are sneaky little thought-worms that get into your brain and shut you down from the process of change.  In this class, we'll lay out the major types of resistances and how to break through them into the change you desire.

This class is for those who are serious about making change but who keep getting in their own way when they try to do it.

You'll Learn:

• What the major types of resistances are - both mental/emotional and energetic 

• The secret to clearing each type of resistance so you can soar forward 

• The one major pitfall that you REALLY want to avoid when trying to make change in your life. 

Don't miss this powerful life-changing class.  It will blow you away and get you moving forward quickly.

PLEASE ARRIVE 10-15 minutes EARLY - We will be setting intentional space at 2:00PM and the doors will close to new arrivals at that time.  

Don't Wait To Register - Our classes tend to sell out well in advance of the class time.  We only have room for 15 people, so the space goes quickly.  Register now to save your space.

Parking is readily available on our street.  Because it's a Sunday, resident parking isn't enforced, so you can park in any legal space.  

Please do not wear fragrances!  Kelle is allergic to most fragrances (yes, even essential oils), so please don't wear them.
results.how_to_find_us: Same building as #19
results.name: Overcoming Your Inner Resistance to Change - SOLD OUT

results.description:
Hi All,

Spring is not quite upon us yet, so let's continue with sketching indoors at the Cambridge Public Library! The main building of the library was built in 1888, in the style very typical of Boston, the Richardson Romanesque. 

In 2009, the library went through a major expansion project with tripled the size of the library. It was the first building to use the European Double Skin-Curtain wall technology in the USA. 

This leads to a very interesting dueling architectural design of the very old and very new side by side. So choose your subject, old or new, and let's do some sketching! Hope to see you there. 

- Miriam
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet at the entrance in the new section. I will have a dark blue messenger bag with green and white flower shapes.
results.name: Let's Sketch! The Cambridge Public Library

results.description:
Seeing that this cookbook club has become a confessional forum of sorts for me, I have another embarrassing secret to share. (I'd be covering my eyes in shame if I didn't need my hands to type, right now.)


The epic Gourmet cookbook was the first cookbook I ever purchased for my kitchen. I remember it was after I graduated from college, I was outfitting my new apartment and celebrating the next chapter in my life.


Can you guess how many recipes I've cooked from this book? None. A big fat whopping zero. Nada. I think I bookmarked one to try out at a later date, and now here I am 10 years later. Sad, but true.


My copy of Gourmet is in pristine condition—good as new—and is screaming for someone to crack it open and explore the 1000+ recipes. 

I welcome you to join me as I dive into this month's featured cookbook. Regardless of the slightly illegible yellow typeface (not sure what the creative director was thinking), there are a bunch of great recipes for us to enjoy.

Note :: You don't have to buy a copy of the cookbook in order to participate this event. Check your local library or ask a friend to borrow their copy.

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

INSTRUCTIONS :: How the Cookbook Club Works

1. Join our Meetup group! All cooking levels are welcome. Don't be shy. You're in good company!

2. RSVP via Meetup. Note :: Each of our "feast" events will happen the 1st Sunday of every month, focusing on a different cookbook, author, or blog.

3. Grab yourself a copy of this month's featured cookbook, "Gourmet" (ask your library, borrow from a friend, order online or purchase at a local retailer) and experiment with a few of the recipes.

4. Pick a minimum of 1 recipe that you will make for our feast. Be sure to read through all of the instructions to make sure you have the proper tools, dishes, and ingredients. (I made that mistake at a previous feast.)

5. In the comments section below, share which recipe you will be bringing, and the page number (this info will help me as I'm preparing a new idea for our feast events). I'll keep track of what everyone is bringing and make sure we don't have any overlaps. Note :: It might be wise to pick a backup recipe in case your 1st choice is already taken.

6. Day of the event (or the day before). Prepare your recipe according to the directions provided in the cookbook. Source ingredients locally, if you can. As tempting as it might be to alter the recipe or make a substitution, please follow the instructions as closely as possible. This will allow the group to truly experience the author's array of recipes.

7. Get ready for a fun time with really amazing people. We really are a great group of home cooks and foodies. Come with an open mind and empty stomach! Together we will feast on your wonderful food and share our experiences with one another. Feel free to bring your cookbook in order to highlight certain pages or make notes on recipes you especially loved. Post-it notes and pencils are provided.

8. If you feel inspired to bring fancier serving dishes (for photos), I won't stop you! But it's not essential . . . just slightly more fun.

9. Don't forget to bring a few small storage containers for leftovers. You'll have the best lunch that following Monday, guaranteed.

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

WHAT'S INCLUDED :: (Stuff you don't have to worry about.)

1. Tables + Chairs

2. Linens, Tableware + Utensils

3. Extra Serving Utensils

4. Non-Alcoholic Beverages: water, fresh coffee (with caffeine), tea, and hot cocoa. Note :: If you want to bring wine or beer to share, please feel free to do so!

5. Photographer (me or my friend, Paul — pictures to be used mainly for our group photo album)

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

TIPS + IDEAS :: (From our fellow cookbook collectors)

1. Go out of your comfort zone. Try a new technique or work with ingredients you've never used before. Bring the final dish, regardless of the outcome—good or bad—and let everyone learn from your experience! (Thank you Renee for this suggestion.)

2. There's no guarantee your dish will remain HOT by the time we are ready to eat. Consider recipes that not only travel well, but also can be served at room temperature. Either way, you're welcome to bring your own heating elements, crock pots, or warmers. I just can't guarantee there will always be an outlet accessible.

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

IN CLOSING . . .

Many of the members in this groups are super excited to be participating in our feasts. So, if you're lucky enough to reserve a spot on the list . . . please be sure you can actually make it to the event. I wouldn't want spots to be inadvertently reserved, while there might be other members willing to attend the event. Plus, it will help me get a more accurate head count for the venue (and for renting chairs). Thanks so much! —Jessica

results.description:
Free Preview

Lightworker 101: Exploration Series

Are you a Lightworker desiring to tap into a deeper awareness of your light? Are you on a quest to serve a higher purpose? Do you have difficulty staying grounded or are prone to stimulation overload?

A Lightworker is anyone who devotes their life to being a bright light in the world.

Join me on Sunday, April 3rd at 2:00pm for a (free) 45-minute preview of the Lightworker 101: Exploration Series.

The Lightworker 101: Exploration series is for Lightworkers, empaths, sensitives, and for anyone who feels called to Lightworking and will meet on three Sundays, for two hours - April 17th, May 1st, and May 15th.

Within this series, we will journey through the fundamentals of being a Lightworker including some practical tools to enhance or prepare you in carrying out your service as Lightworker.  

*Please note, this is not a course on how to conduct Lightworking/healing.

A sampling of the topics to be covered, over the three weeks includes

• The purpose/role of Lightworkers

• Lightworker amnesia/awakening

• Lightworkers as empaths


• Meditation techniques to ground, clear, fill, and protect

• Lightworker self-care 

• Importance of self-love and a healthy heart chakra as a Lightworker

Hope to see you there!  There is no charge to attend this preview.  More information on the series coming soon.

***********************

The Lightworker 101: Exploration Series is an extension of the work that I do with clients.  As a Lightworker, Spiritual Counselor, and Intuitive Energy Healer, I help other Lightworkers in transition by offering guidance, through healing, transformation, and devotional consciousness work.  I am deeply honored to be able to inspire and share this content with those wishing to enhance their Lightworker service or others on their quest to awaken their Lightworker potentials.

My intention is a create a Lightworker community where we can connect and support each other.

Love and Blessings~

Kelly

[masked]                                                             kellybuckowski.com

results.description:
Back by popular demand, due to technical glitches that prevented the first showing and many wishing to have attended that could not anyway, our Catholic Film Fest is right back to where it started. 

We have hurdled, tested, re-tested, and finally overcome the technical difficulties that we had encountered in the first preview attempt. Due also to the fact that it was so cold (-9°  -a record not previously broken since 1934!), many had strongly expressed an interest but could not attend. 

*     *     *     *     *     *     *     *

Therefore we are happy to announce:

The “Monastic Cooking Club” in conjunction with our Business Sponsor, the Civic Friary®, is continuing to host a Catholic Film Fest,

                   FOCUS OF FAITH IN MOVIES & FILM 

starting with:


Babette’s Feast

Although theAbstract by Wendy Wright in the Journal of Religion and Film seems to intelligently depict the cinematically themed dynamic of religion, the focus of this Film Fest is “Faith” and that focus takes on a considerably different (albeit not necessarily incompatible) angle of appreciation.

The film Babette’s Feast is a truly remarkable work of art, indeed a love story. “Love” is depicted in the true Saintly tradition of Valentine’s Day, appropriately for when this first movie of our Film Fest had been scheduled for viewing. 

Now that we have re-scheduled the first showing for Mercy Sunday, April 3rd (first Sunday after Easter), the event takes on a whole new and deep appreciation.

While watching the movie, we recommend an attentiveness to the film's subtle background of silence and solitude while fully appreciating how the unfolding story helps spawn insights that will indeed stir one’s soul and generate a prayerful appreciation of Faith at work though love and service. Slowly, and peacefully, that love and service indicate that by following the path God lays before her (or any of us in real life), Babette carries her cross without trying to make it any lighter or any heavier.

Babette’s yielding to a solid Peace offered in Christian Faith universally to all at all times and in unity with Jesus the Christ her Risen Savior, makes this “main character” of the film show that the real Main Character in life is the Holy Presence of God.

Alleluias are typically an Easter form of expression, in the Victory of Christ through His Holy Cross for the longer Season of Easter (Lent is 40 days and Easter is over fifty days!). And as there is no Resurrection without the Cross, likewise there is Mercy with that realization. This movie is indeed about Mercy, a wonderful way to focus on the Holy Faith on Divine Mercy Sunday. The very beautiful Cross given to us by God, has us proclaiming “Alleluia” in this realization of Divine Mercy as this film partakes in the sweet sufferings we endure through unity in Christ with the Hope of fulfillment in the making.

Before the movie, we will recite the Chaplet of Divine Mercy (takes about 5 minutes) in both Spanish and English. 

Dinner & a Movie! Can't go wrong there--we'll spend a few short minutes on Evening Prayer as Grace before the Meal, which can be found your Smart Phone at: 

  http://www.divineoffice.org//easter-w02-sun-ep2/?date=20160403

Bring only your love & mercy to this event (and/or any donations of food, etc.), as it is indeed a FREE EVENT!


CALL 781-C-FRIARS for more information, questions, etc.
results.name: FOCUS OF FAITH IN MOVIES & FILM

results.description:
Have you ever tried to make change and then found yourself falling back again into old patterns?  

Does the fear of not being good enough, or losing what you have, or not knowing what comes next stop you in your tracks? 

Then you're running into resistances!

Resistances are sneaky little thought-worms that get into your brain and shut you down from the process of change.  In this class, we'll lay out the major types of resistances and how to break through them into the change you desire.

This class is for those who are serious about making change but who keep getting in their own way when they try to do it.

You'll Learn:

• What the major types of resistances are - both mental/emotional and energetic 

• The secret to clearing each type of resistance so you can soar forward 

• The one major pitfall that you REALLY want to avoid when trying to make change in your life. 

Don't miss this powerful life-changing class.  It will blow you away and get you moving forward quickly.


Please Register by Using this Paypal Link to Confirm Your Space

Paypal.me/KelleSparta/10

PLEASE ARRIVE 10-15 minutes EARLY - We will be setting intentional space at 2:00PM and the doors will close to new arrivals at that time.  

Don't Wait To Register - Our classes tend to sell out well in advance of the class time.  We only have room for 15 people, so the space goes quickly.  Register now to save your space.  Sold out?  Join us on our meetup at http://www.meetup.com/LoveYourLifeBoston/ to find out about more of our events.

Parking is readily available on our street. Because it's a Sunday, resident parking isn't enforced, so you can park in any legal space.  

Please do not wear fragrances!  Kelle is allergic to most fragrances (yes, even essential oils), so please don't wear them.


About Your Presenters:

Kelle Sparta - Transformational Shaman - Kelle is a leading expert in the subject of change.  She has been studying personal growth, self-help, metaphysics, energy work, etc. for almost 40 years.  She is the author of the book The Change-Seeker's Guide to Creating a Life You Can Love and runs year-long groups on Creating a Life You Can Love.

Kathy Scheiern, PhD - Transformational Shaman - Kathy got her PhD in what creates lasting transformation in individuals and groups.  She is one of the world's leading experts on the subject of transformation.  She has been working with groups and individuals on change processes for over 20 years.  She is co-facilitates the Create a Life You Can Love program.

About: Love Your Life

If you are a strong woman or a nice guy, there are specific issues that you encounter when you are trying to find your bliss.  We have spent the last 10 years identifying those issues and creating a system to help you remove the blocks to your happiness.  Our signature system walks you through the steps needed to:

• Claim your space


• Put yourself at the top of your own priority list (without feeling guilty)


• Ask for and get the help you need


• Stop feeling empty


• Feel solid and safe no matter what is going on around you or who is upset


• Finally experience what joy and fulfillment


• Be able to celebrate your successes, rather than just rushing off to your next task


• Open to receive the love you've always wanted


• Drain the well of rage that lives inside you and find peace for yourself


• Take control of yourself and your life to live out of choice and response rather than reaction


And, best of all, it's all available for roughly the same cost as a nice vacation.  So you could take a vacation and feel better for a couple of months, or you could take our course and feel better for the rest of your life.  The choice is yours.  For more about our program, visit us on the web at www.CreateALifeYouCanLove.com

results.name: Love Your Life: Overcoming You Inner Resistance To Change

results.description:
About TeamAIDAsha


TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fundraising program jointly organized by the volunteers from Boston/MIT chapters of Association for India's Development (AID) and Asha for Education. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome.  Our training and fundraising program runs from April through October every year.

Information session

Join us at our FREE information session for new runners for 2016 season. Learn about the program, training and fundraising from our coaches, alumni runners and volunteers.

Who can attend 

Anyone interested in learning more about the program. No running experience required. 

Agenda

• Welcome message

• AID overview

• Asha overview 

• TeamAIDAsha program overview

• Training details from coach + Q&A

• Alum runner panel + Q&A

• Closing & next steps

Details:

TeamAIDAsha is an annual marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program jointly organized by the volunteers from Boston/MIT chapters of Association for India's Development (AID) and Asha for Education. We train runners for their full or half marathon races (DC Marine Corps Marathon, Lowell half/full marathon) and runners raise donations for AID and Asha.

Over the last 13 years we have helped more than 300 runners to finish full/half marathons and raise more than $750,000 for grassroots social development and educational projects in India. We are preparing for a bigger and better season this year.

At this FREE information session you can learn all about the training and fund-raising from our coaches, alumni runners and volunteers.

Please share this event with any of your friends and family members who may be interested. Everyone is welcome, no prior running or fund-raising experience required.

For more information, please visit us at www.teamaidasha.org
results.name: Introduction to marathon/half marathon training and fundraising

results.description:
Join us for this very special women’s healing afternoon. The Transformational Healing Ritual was developed in 1989 by Vicki Noble as part of the curriculum of the Motherpeace School for Female Shamanic Healers. Since then Noble has facilitated this ritual in venues all over the world, in tandem with some very fine musicians and drummers; she and folk singer Julie Felix facilitated the ritual at the Maternal Gift Economy conference in April 2015. 

The ritual invites everyone present to participate, and no experience is required. As indigenous cultures around the world have done on a regular basis, we drum, sing, and perform hands-on healing in a directed ritual setting. After an hour of entraining in this unified state, everyone is blessed with an overall feeling of well-being and those struggling with life-threatening or debilitating illnesses often find themselves in remission. 

Vicki Noble is a feminist healer, co-creator of Motherpeace and author of numerous books, including Shakti Woman: Feeling Our Fire, Healing Our World and The Double Goddess: Women Sharing Power; her books have been translated into several languages. Since her shamanic healing powers awakened spontaneously in the late 1970s, she has traveled and taught internationally.

Julie Felix, grew up in Santa Barbara, moved to England, and shot to fame as the first folk singer on a major record label (Decca), hosting her own BBC television show; she’s been traveling and performing internationally for the last 50 years. In the 1990s, she discovered the Goddess and started singing at Goddess conferences and leading tours.

Sponsored by Women’s Lodge:
Please RSVP to Nouri Newman [masked].

Women only. Cost: $20 per person, less if low-income. Bring drums and rattles.

...................... Important Update...........................

We are excited about this Sunday's Transformative Healing Ritual with Vicki Noble and Julie Felix. Please read the following updates carefully:


Weather: Snow is forecast for Sunday, but not so much that we need to cancel. We ask that you leave wet footwear outside our ritual space. Please bring slippers or indoor shoes to change into.

Parking: There are only a few spaces behind the church, most of which will be filled by organizers. If you need space near the entrance because of limited mobility, please email [masked] to save a space for you. The Medford U.U. Church is on 147 High Street; please use the side entrance on Powderhouse Road.

Drums and rattles: We have a group of designated drummers, so additional drums are not necessary. If you are an experienced drummer able to come at 2:00 to meet with the drumming group, please email Lynn Roberson, [masked]. Do bring a rattle if you have one.

Pillows and blankets: We will have six â€œbedsâ€ (yoga mats with blankets and pillows) in the center of our circle for women receiving healing. If you plan to receive healing and need additional support (an inflatable pad, special pillow, etc.) please bring it with you. We will have several women channeling healing energy around each of the six recipients — if you need a backjack, zafu, or folded blanket to sit comfortably on the floor, please bring whatever you need.
Thank you in advance to everyone who is coming to receive the healing energy of this ritual. Vicki's long experience with this process tells her that the greater the healing need, the bigger the energy that we will be able to channel, for the benefit of all participants!

Registration will begin at 1:45; doors to the ritual space will open at 2:15 (2:00 for drummers). $20 donation is requested, less for low income. We will provide water and light snacks — fruit, nuts, chocolate, cheese and crackers. RSVP to [masked] if you have not done so already.

-Cut-off shuffles

results.description: This event is to celebrate and honor the essence of the quintessential fruit of the sun and earth, the olive.  We'll start out with introductions so attendees can talk about their own interests, desires and experiences with olive oil. I'll talk about olive oil generally and relate my own experiences as an educated consumer, how I got started with this love affair with it, and why I'm so crazy about this fragrant green-gold ambrosia. Then we'll do a tasting and notice the various qualities that arise: fruity, peppery, spicy, bitter, grassy, bold or delicate. We’ll discuss what we experienced from a sensory and possibly even spiritual perspective. We might have time to talk a bit about the best ways to use olive oil in our cooking.  We’ll conclude with a potluck dinner (with plenty of olive oil, of course) and good conversation.

results.description:
Let's go race karts at F1 Boston in Braintree. 

Here's a description:


F1 Boston offers the ultimate indoor kart racing experience, from Arrive & Drive open racing sessions. Their two European-style tracks offer plenty of racing thrills – sharp turns, a corkscrew and tunnel. You'll come in and suit up, receive a driver briefing, and pit yourself against other drivers scored by their computerized, split-second timing system. The track holds 12 racer at a time so I cap this at 12. HOwever if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will open it up which means each group of 12 will race back to back.
There is a Groupon available for $22 including license and 1 race (reg $40 including license). Got mine!
https://www.groupon.com/deals/f1-boston-2

The Fi website:  

http://www.f1boston.com/

Please review the rules and requirements before signing up  for safety and risk info.


You do need to have a valid a driver's license to obtain an F! Boston One Day license. This is required to book an Arrive and Drive race. They will provide suits and helmets.

Arrive & Drive vs. Pre-Booking Track Time: Anyone can go to F1 Boston to arrive and drive, they do allow booking 48 hour ahead. This means that it is a first-come-first-serve basis. Sometimes F1 Boston may have corporate or private events that would block off a track for a few hours (this option was $800 for a group for 1/2 hr). F1 Boston recommends that we check on the status of the track a two days before. I will call the Friday before to make sure there is no event blocking the track. I will send out an update email about this. Assuming there are no events blocking the track, each of us can pre-book for our own spot using a credit card on Friday, 4/1 . By doing this, you don’t have to wait in line; just come in, fill out a waiver form, and be ready to race. Pre-booking requires that you pre-pay the full $40 price or use your groupon.
