Due to several requests we will be going back to The Breakheart Reservation in Saugus. We will be walking 3-4 miles.  

We will be inviting several meetup groups.

Breakheart Reservation is a 640-acre hardwood forest with jagged, rocky outcroppings, two fresh-water lakes, and a rambling section of the Saugus River. Seven rocky hills, over 200 feet high, provide vistas of Boston, southern New Hampshire and central Massachusetts. An extensive trail system through the woodlands guides visitors to various areas of the reservation. Fishing in Silver and Pearce Lakes, hiking the trails and birdwatching by the Saugus River are popular year-round activities.

We will meet at the Christopher P Dunne Visitor Center. You will need either hiking shoes or sneakers. Bring water and snacks. Afterwards, we will grab a bite at a local restaurant.

If you miss the hike join us at the restaurant. 

Directions: From north or south: Take Rte. 1 to Lynn Fells Parkway exit, follow Lynn Fells Parkway a short distance, take a right onto Forest Street. Park entrance is after Kasabuski Rink.  

Parking: At the end of Forest Street; and if full, try the little lot along side the skating rink which leads to the back of Ocean State Job Lot/Target where there is plenty of parking.

Maps: Available on this page

http://www.saugus.org/FOBR

Afterwards we will go to the famous Kowloon Restaurant on Rt 1 for dinner and drinks.

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
We sit all day for days, weeks, months and years at a time and yet how did we get here? How do we come to sit? How do we leave sitting to stand, walk, run or dance? In this Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement Series, we will explore the developmental origins of this everyday activity and many possibilities for the variety of simple and more complex movements involved. Every lesson will introduce yet another way to sit, more easily, more gracefully, more comfortably and with more curiosity and joy.

Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement® (ATM) lessons are verbally guided movement sequences, which help to clarify fundamental biological movement patterns and bring you closer to your potential. By slowing down, reducing your effort, and becoming aware of your habits and preferences in movement, more of your whole self becomes involved in every action. Previously unseen possibilities become available. Your system becomes more efficient and free to move with ease and spontaneity. For most, a difference can be felt after one lesson.  Repeated regular attendance deepens your sensitivity and ability to integrate these profound shifts into your everyday movement and life.

Tree of Life Tai Chi Center, 11 Bow Street, Somerville

Questions? call/ email Tiffany:[masked] • [masked]

Cost: $120 for 7 week series. $20 drop-in. Please call/email ahead.

7 Sundays 4-5pm • April 3 - May 22 (no class May 8)

http://www.tiffanysankary.com/Effortless_Sitting.html

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.

results.description:
</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with four-minute "mini-dates" with the opposite sex.

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com">http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

results.description:
2nd floor . Get to the top of the steps there and go to the area along the back wall area.
  I get comments saying (rightly so) that all I schedule are pub events. Well this is for coffee or tea tipplers.

There will be no pressure to order food, but you can access their menu through this link, http://www.harvardsquare.com/algiers-coffee-house

Great atmosphere you boozers are missing out on. Friendly waitstaff, no pressure to order, mingling environment. No booze! and we're not sorry!
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the area around (see description). Ask if someone is with Meetup. If he/ she is, great. If not, he she will likely say, "what's meetup?" and you have clinched a conversation.
results.name: Meetup for Abstainers

results.description:
The votes are in!  Our next meeting will be on a Sunday evening - we will meet on April 3, at 5:30 PM at Redstone Grill in Burlington, MA.  Please RSVP for this meetup by March 30 so I can make a reservation.

The book for this meeting will be The Bookseller of Kabul by Asne Seierstad.  Finishing the book is not required, feel free to join us (but don't hate us if we talk about the ending....).

The book for May will be Nectar in a Sieve.

Hope to see everyone there!

Kelly
results.name: April meeting - The Bookseller of Kabul

results.description:
Come join us, Sunday April 3rd, at 1950 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge MA, for an evening of dancing, music, food, and more dancing!

5:30-6:30 Family Dance and Open Band
6:30-7:30 Potluck Dinner
7:30-10:30 Contra dance time!

Caller: Adina Gordon
Music: Too Many Fiddles (Charlie Pilzer and Friends)

During the family dance portion, we welcome you to join the OPEN BAND led by Charlie Pilzer and Vince O'Donnell. A common tunelist will be posted below.


Potluck: please bring something to share, a serving utensil, and label what you've made for allergy courtesy.
-----------------------------------------------------------
BIDA is excited to be launching a new series of Family Dances! These will be family oriented dance afternoons in conjunction with our regularly schedules dances. Bring your kids! Tell your neighbors and schools! Come without kids of your own, ready to be friendly :) Did you know that BIDA stands for Boston Intergenerational Dance Advocates? Well, kids are the upcoming generation, and a vital part of our community.
----------------------------------------------------------- 
Please feel free to join us at 7:00 for a beginner's lesson if you're fresh to contra dancing.  Bring someone new to contra dancing to the workshop and we'll give you both passes to get in free at a future dance!

Admission is our standard sliding scale of $5-12 for adults (and counts for the regular dance following, should you choose to stay) and $3 each for children.

Public Transportation (recommended): We are across the street from the Porter Square Red Line stop.


Parking: Free street parking (meters and residential are open to all on Sundays). Don't park in the Shaw's parking lot because they tow.

See you there!
results.name: BIDA 1st Sunday Contra + Family Dance + Potluck!

results.description: Let's eat at the famous Kowloon restaurant. We will meet another group there.
results.name: Kowloon

results.description: Bring your favorite deck of cards. Join us for a circle of practice ! tarot Lenomand Oracle bring what ever you read and flip with us. Fee for circle is $10.
results.name: Sunday Night Card Circle

results.description:
Join Bill, Kris, Eric and others on Sunday evening at 6pm for dinner at the Bolton Street Tavern. Enjoy a conversation about "well being" (i.e. physical well being, spiritual well being, emotional well being, etc.). Bill, Kris, and Eric will share some tips on healthy eating, physical fitness and spiritual health. We'd love to have your company. Come have some fun on Sunday night. Enjoy some great food and great conversation just down the road from the Rail Trail.

(Note: Please bring some cash to pay for your meal and drinks.)
results.name: Sunday Community Dinner

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 4/3 6:00

results.description: We will meet another group at the famous Kowloon Restaurant. Classic kitschy decor.
results.name: Kowloon Restaurant

group.name: Best Things to do in New England

results.description:
“The true birthplace is that wherein for the first time one looks intelligently upon oneself; my first homelands have been books, and to a lesser degree schools.”--from Memoirs of Hadrian

Both an exploration of character and a reflection on the meaning of history, Memoirs of Hadrian has received international acclaim since its first publication in France in 1951. In it, Marguerite Yourcenar reimagines the Emperor Hadrian's arduous boyhood, his triumphs and reversals, and finally, as emperor, his gradual reordering of a war-torn world, writing with the imaginative insight of a great writer of the twentieth century while crafting a prose style as elegant and precise as those of the Latin stylists of Hadrian's own era.
results.name: Yourcenar: Memoirs of Hadrian

group.name: Classic Books: A Book Club for Voracious Readers

results.description:
The monthly Morningside Jazz Jam at Artlounge Arlington is a great way to meet people. Bring your instrument and sit in and meet a lot of other musicians, or just come and enjoy some live music. This jam is for instrumentalists. Vocalists, see message below.

Artlounge offers craft beer, wine and delicious snacks. For more information on Morningside Music Studio, visit our website, www.morningsidemusicstudio.com

There is a $6 cover charge


For vocalists, you should instead go to the monthly Boston Jazz Singer Showcase/Open Mic and Ryles - more info at https://www.facebook.com/BostonJazzSingersShowcase?ref=hl

Next vocal showcase is March 8th at Ryles
results.how_to_find_us: I will reserve a table for you all!
results.name: Come to our next open jazz jam!

group.name: Morningside Studio Jazz Jams/Events in Arlington & Cambridge

results.description: We are an small group of dedicated men who seek personal fulfillment in our lives and families. We follow the general outline for running weekly meetings as originates from the Mankind Project. This outline motivates us to seek meaning in our lives at the same time providing emotional and spiritual support to each other. We hope that you will join us.  -Rich Emmel
results.how_to_find_us: We gather weekly on Sunday's at 6:20pm in the far back entrance of the Winchester Unitarian Society Church, 478 Main St., Winchester and move to our meeting room promptly at 6:30pm. The parking lot and entrance is off of the Mystic Valley Parkway.
results.name: Personal Mastery Workgroup

results.name: Let's practice Chinese and English together!

results.description:
This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 ADMISSION INCLUDES:

*Light Appetizers

*Ice Breaker

*Amex Gift Cards for Ice Breaker Winners

*Supplies/Name Tags

PRE-PAY HERE: http://mixnmatchboston.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have an ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

Ice Breaker game with prizes -Full menu is available (pay as you go)  -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own. 

 What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-late 30's's.

results.description:
There will be stimuli for each meeting to inspire the conversation. The stimuli can be anything, such as a picture, a short story, a breaking news, etc. Each meeting includes member and stimuli introduction, small team and whole group discussion.

Every attendee is required to raise 1-3 questions inspired by the stimuli. We will discuss why these questions are important; how these questions relate to one's personal life experience; what is one's perspectives on these questions, and how the discussion might affect one's future thinking.

This is a place to share our souls and learn from others. This is not a place to promote any particular school of thoughts, beliefs, faiths, political views, etc. We must keep an open mind, respect each other, and agree to disagree.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be at the back separate session of the dinning hall, which is accessible from the backdoor towards the parking lot. There will be a sign on the table saying "Soulful Cafe"
results.name: We will enjoy coffee and have a soulful discussion inspired by stimuli

results.description:
We are meeting at the Publick House in Brookline.  Each month we'll have a member driven topic to discuss.  Feel free to offer one in the comment section.

Let's talk about economics this month.  From highly developed philosophical thought (of which I'll listen to) to sleeves-rolled kitchen-table talk on free markets and co-ops and how to make choices that can lead to developing political will for less government in the economies of our lives.

Please note any reading materials that you would like to share or bring them with you. 


We'll start with a brief re-cap from last month and then move on to discussing economic systems and then practical daily choices.  Or something along those lines.

Thanks!

Chris J.
results.name: Libertarian Monthly Meetup: Economics - At What Price Liberty?

group.name: The Boston Area Libertarian Meetup Group

results.description:
Remember that suit and tie your Dad wore to work every day? When folks got gussied up to go out to a restaurant or a movie? The time when your neighbors went by Mr. and Mrs. So-and-so, and if that baseball went through their window there'd be hell to pay? Okay, so maybe you don't. But some of us (ahem) older types still do. In the last several decades formality has gradually given way to customs of leisure, from dress to language to social stature. Business casual is the code of the day, CEOs go by their first names in the hallway, and formal business letter language has given way to internet forum text-ese. Is this a good thing? And is it a permanent thing, or the swinging of a pendulum? Were our ancestors unnecessarily stuffy and pretentious, or were they onto something we've lost touch with? Join us in a fun and, well, informal discussion of the merits of gussying up and puttin' on the ritz.


Hope to see you there (jacket not required) :)
results.name: Casual Day: Formality (or not) in our everyday lives

Last weekend I had the privilege of running a private workshop in which model Danni LaBelle provided a wonderful subject for boudoir photography.

At no small expense and with a great deal of persuasion she has agreed to return to the studio for a full one day session on Sunday April 3.

She is an absolute dream to work with and with her exuberance, extensive wardrobe and undoubted professionalism she is sure to provide some wonderful opportunities to add to your portfolio.

To ensure a comfortable shooting environment I am limiting the participants to just four.  Because of this, the cost is a little higher than usual at $199 per person.and those who purchased a 2016 pass will be welcome to attend for 50% of the fee. (Just edit the amount on the PayPal page). 

Attendees must be familiar with their camera settings as this will be an intensive shoot with no instruction given apart from confirming the aperture by measuring the light with a flash meter. You will be expected to know how to operate your camera in manual mode and have an ability to adjust aperture, shutter speed and ISO without help.

The session will be split into two parts:  

Morning Session  [masked]

Afternoon session[masked] approx.

All lighting gear and wireless triggers will be provided.

results.description:
Hello Juniper NE Meet Up Group!


IETF-95 Remote Hub will be held April 4 – 8th, 2016 hosted at Juniper's New England Innovation Center in Westford, MA.   Remote-hub is a new concept for IETF. The goal is to encourage greater IETF participation and build local IETF communities.

There are several working groups listed in the agenda including MPLS, TEAS, Babel TOF, IDR, Detnet, PCF and more.

Here are steps to follow for registration (please rsvp using the directions below and not thru MeetUp):

1. Click the polling link

http://doodle.com/pol...

­2. Visit Evernote for a list of the working group and sessions at

https://www.evernote....

­

3. Select the time slots in doodle based on WG meetings.


4. If you are signing up for social hour, please sign up for 17:30-19:30 slot of Thursday April 7th.

Please register using the doodle poll as soon as possible since seating is limited!

About Boston Remote Hub

The Objective of the remote hub is to encourage greater IETF participation, to provide a facility to live/interactive participation of IETF conferences.  Also build this into a more organized remote hub and also have an easy way to get-together for chats and a beer or two when the IETF isn’t meeting. Frequency and topic to be determined by the membership, but emphasis is on decidedly casual. For additional information, please contact Ravi at [masked].

results.description:
"The Farmers Market Cookbook" lands in bookstores April 4th!

Join us as we celebrate its release at EVOO Restaurant in Cambridge, MA. We’ll nibble on recipes inspired by the book and talk about how to make the most of locally grown foods. Authors Brett Grohsgal and Julia Shanks will share their tips for buying local, understanding the differences between local and organic, and how to best enjoy the farmers market and CSA bounties.

As Adam Rapoport, Editor-in-Chief of Bon Appétit writes, “You know how you go to the farmers market and you buy all sorts of amazing produce but never know what to do with it all when you get home? Well, this book is what. Its advice is clear and instructive, its recipes delicious and, most importantly, manageable. Along with all those wonderful fruits and vegetables, this book belongs in your market tote.”

Evoo Restaurant has been a favorite in the Boston dining scene for its local and sustainable cuisine. They support dozens of local farmers year-round and grow on their own rooftop in the summer. We’re so honored to celebrate with owners Peter and Colleen McCarthy.

The event is free; books and beverages will be available for purchase.

Monday, April 4, 2016
5pm – 7pm
EVOO Restaurant
350 3rd Street, Kendall Square
Cambridge MA

Julia Shanks - chef and serial entrepreneur – developed a taste for great foods when she was 12 years old, cooking her way through the Time-Life Cookbooks. As a chef, she worked in restaurants around the country, feeding her passion for fresh, local and seasonal foods.

Julia received her professional training as a chef at the California Culinary Academy in San Francisco. She also earned her BA from Hampshire College and MBA from Babson College. Today, Julia consults with restaurants, farms and food producers, helping them maximize profits and streamline revenues. Her second book, The Farmer’s Office, will be published in the fall of 2016.

In her tiny, urban garden in Cambridge, MA, she harvests vegetables seven months out of the year.

Brett Grohsgal has been the chef in 9 establishments and cooked in seven others, from New England to Louisiana to California and at sea, and over a twenty year period. As Brett’s passion for cooking great foods evolved he began to grow his own produce and in 1996 he and his wife, Dr. Christine Bergmark, bought 100 acres of prime land in Lexington Park, Maryland.

Brett manages Even’ Star Organic Farm for great foods, reliable harvests, and for respectful environmental stewardship. Brett and his treasured crew harvest crops year-round for restaurants, grocery stores, universities, and farmers’ markets. Even’ Star remains committed to the ideal that life is too short, and farm life too arduous, to ever grow or eat boring foods.
results.name: The Farmers Market Cookbook - Book Signing and Talk

results.description:
So you have a LinkedIn account and you’ve set up your profile… Now what? Ever wondered how LinkedIn could help you improve your career prospects, and identify and connect with influential people?

Join Socializing for Justice for a ProfDev (professional development) training

“Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network” with Alyson Weiss on Monday, April 4th from 6:00-8:30 PM at The NonProfit Center by South Station.

Fee: $15 advance/$30 door - split with trainer
Limited space - register ahead of time by RSVPing yes 
Credit cards accepted online and at the door.
Newcomers always welcomed!

*This is a fragrance-free event. Please do not wear fragrances (scented lotions,  perfumes, etc.) or smoke just prior to attending. Thank you.*


ProfDev: Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network
Many people sign up on LinkedIn on the advice of their friends or family members, but never take full advantage of its tools and features. In this interactive workshop, we will discuss four steps to creating a strategy to actually USE LinkedIn, based on your personal career goals. You’ll learn how to make connections on LinkedIn with people in your current networks, research target connections, reach out to those connections effectively, and keep your new connections active and current. At the end of this ProfDev, you will leave with a personalized strategy for making LinkedIn work for you and with a formula for writing cold messages that actually work.

Please note that this workshop doesn’t focus on creating your profile. If time permits, we may spend the last few minutes discussing profile writing, but the majority of this ProfDev will be about how LinkedIn can work for you.


ABOUT OUR PRESENTER
Alyson Weiss is passionate about translating abstract concepts into concrete ideas. She facilitates workshops and meets with clients privately to help job seekers and career changers build their online presence and connect strategically with target contacts to meet their career goals. She is on the board of the Young Nonprofit Professionals Network Boston and works at Tufts University by day.


SCHEDULE
6:00-6:30 Socializing -  bring your own dinner
 6:30-8:30 Training and Q&A

*  DIRECTIONS - The NonProfit Center is located one block from South Station at 89 South Street. The Center is physically accessible through the main lobby.

HELP SPREAD THE WORDS!

Invite friends to the Facebook event. 
Join the SoJust Facebook group.

On Twitter? Follow @SoJust and SoJust's Co-Founder @RobbieSamuels. Don’t forget to tweet about this event using #SoJust and #profdev!


_________________________________________________________ 


Socializing for Justice - www.sojust.org

SoJust hosts events that draw progressives of all stripes that share common values but may work on different issues. We host monthly socials that allow for the possibility of cross-issue connections and run a monthly ProfDev Series, hosted by The NonProfit Center*, which provides access to affordable professional development to increase our individual capacity for movement building.


With 2900 members and 9 1/2 years of creating a diverse cross-issue community in Boston (210+ events!), Socializing for Justice is the best place to find the great people, organizations and community you're looking for while putting the SOCIAL back in social justice.

YES, WE MEAN YOU. We've got members of all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism and professions. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.
results.name: ProfDev: Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network

results.description:
Networking in the North End (FREE)

Riccardo's Ristorante, 175 North St. 4/4, 6PM to 9PM

{We will be by The Bar}

Come Network with other Small Business Owners, Entrepreneurs, and Professionals from Greater Boston Area near Quincy Market....Drink, Bite to Eat, and Conversation....Riccardo's Ristorante in Boston's Historic North End....Hidden Boston says "Top-Notch Italian restaurant that is casual, comfortable, and with few exceptions, reasonably priced".....Open Networking starts at 6PM....Start your business right this year....Come Grow With Us! results.description:
Beyond Connectivity: Security, Analytics & More At The Edge.

A number of Meetup members, led by Jeff Bentley, requested this topic. So here we go!

Directions and Parking Info

The agenda will include:

RECEPTION: 6pm-7pm


PROGRAM: 7pm-9pm


(1) Welcome – MathWorks and IoT Meetup Team

(2) Keynote. Security at The Edge – Robert F. Lentz.


Bio here ... Since October 2009, Mr. Lentz has served as President of Cyber Security Strategies, LLC, a global cyber security consulting company. From November 2007 to October 2009, Mr. Lentz served as Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Cyber, Identity and Information Assurance in the Department of Defense (DoD). From November 2000 to October 2009, he served as the Chief Information Security Officer for DoD. Among his many other responsibilities, Mr. Lentz served as the Chairman of the National Space INFOSEC Steering Council, principal DoD member of the Presidential Sub-Committee on National Security Systems, leader of the DoD IA Steering Council, and the IA Domain Owner of the Global Information Grid Enterprise Information Environment Mission Area. Mr. Lentz began his career with the National Security Agency in 1975. Mr. Lentz also serves as a director of FireEye, Inc.

(3) Rob Purser, Mathworks: Integrating Analytics and Embedded Algorithms

(4) Michael Campbell, Machineshop: Analytics and Microservices

(5) Steve Roberts, KE2 Therm: Unlocking Stranded Data and Accelerating ROI


(6) Discussion

(7) Meetup Housekeeping

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4

results.description:
So you have a LinkedIn account and you’ve set up your profile…


Now what? Ever wondered how LinkedIn could help you improve your career prospects, and identify and connect with influential people?

Join Socializing for Justice for a ProfDev (professional development training) “Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network” with Alyson Weiss on Monday, April 4th from 6:00-8:30 PM at The NonProfit Center by South Station.

Fee: $15 advance/$30 door is split with the trainer.

Limited space - register ahead of time: www.sojust.org

Credit cards accepted online and at the door.

Newcomers always welcomed!

ProfDev: Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network

Many people sign up on LinkedIn on the advice of their friends or family members, but never take full advantage of its tools and features. In this interactive workshop, we will discuss four steps to creating a strategy to actually USE LinkedIn, based on your personal career goals. You’ll learn how to make connections on LinkedIn with people in your current networks, research target connections, reach out to those connections effectively, and keep your new connections active and current. At the end of this ProfDev, you will leave with a personalized strategy for making LinkedIn work for you and with a formula for writing cold messages that actually work.

Please note that this workshop doesn’t focus on creating your profile. If time permits, we may spend the last few minutes discussing profile writing, but the majority of this ProfDev will be about how LinkedIn can work for you.

ABOUT OUR PRESENTER

Alyson Weiss is passionate about translating abstract concepts into concrete ideas. She facilitates workshops and meets with clients privately to help job seekers and career changers build their online presence and connect strategically with target contacts to meet their career goals. She is on the board of the Young Nonprofit Professionals Network Boston and works at Tufts University by day.

Socializing for Justice - www.sojust.org

SoJust hosts events that draw progressives of all stripes who share common values but may work on different issues. We host social events that allow for the possibility of cross-issue connections and run a monthly ProfDev series, hosted by The NonProfit Center, which provides access to affordable professional development to increase our individual capacity for movement building.

With 2,900 members and 9 1/2 years of creating a diverse cross-issue community in Boston (over 200 events!), Socializing for Justice is the best place to find the great people, organizations and community you're looking for while putting the SOCIAL back in social justice.


YES, WE MEAN YOU. We've got members of all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism and professions. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.
results.name: Using LinkedIn to Build Your Professional Network

Drinks On Tap is a monthly social meet up for the Boston Area mobile developer community.  Come meet for a drink and catch up on new mobile developments during our next event at Ned Devine's in Boston from 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM!

A big thanks to our presenters … 

    Have something to share? Apply to demo at Drinks on Tap.

Pavlok App / Alarm Clock

Meet Pavlok:  The first device that breaks habits by deleting temptation.  Pavlok associates a mild zap with your bad habit, training your brain to stop liking the habit.  Using the alarm clock vibrate, beep or ZAP yourself awake! 

Based on its founders’ true love story, Jess, Meet Ken is a dating app for women to recommend guys who may not be right for them but could be GREAT for someone else.  All men must be nominated by a woman who knows him best, writing why he’s so great.  When a man and woman match they may chat or the woman may chat with the lady who nominated the guy, to learn a bit more about him before an introduction is made.

Fabric makes monitoring your app on the go with real-time alerts when something is critically affecting your app.  See full stack traces, # of affected users, and the breakdown of devices, platforms and more from your mobile device.

Tonight's sponsor:

Wayfair sells furniture and home goods online and everything we do is powered by technology. We are growing like crazy and our mobile team powers a lot of this growth by building apps that drive revenue approaching $1M per day!


    Want to sponsor Drinks on Tap? Contact us.


Event Host:

</a><a href="http://raizlabs.com/">Raizlabs is a tightly-knit team of mobile experts dedicated to building great software. We've crafted award-winning apps since the launch of the iTunes App Store in 2008. Join us.

More about Drinks On Tap:

Join the Meetup at http://DrinksOnTap.org/

Contact us to become a sponsor.

Apply to demo at Drinks On Tap.

#DrinksOnTap, @DrinksOnTap, and DrinksOnTap.org

This is the third in a series of one-hour, semi-private (4 person) clinics offered for four weeks by Terry Felty, PGA.  We'll have 4 consecutive weekly sessions, with Mondays for Women and Tuesdays for Men.  Cost is $30 per person, per session (Terry's rate is $120 for one hour--see note below about cancelling)

You should sign up for the sessions independently because the lessons are not going to build on the previous week--however, we ask that to be fair to everyone, please sign up for a maximum of 2 sessions to start out until everyone's had a chance to sign up.

These clinic sessions are limited to four people each night and you must be a member of the ASGA to take advantage of these events.   See www.singlesgolf.com if you would like to join.

NOTE:  it is very important that you keep your RSVP up-to-date! Sometimes things happen that are out of your control, however, if you cancel within 48 hours of the event you must make sure there is a replacement for you to attend or you will be required to pay the $30 fee--it would not be fair to the other 3 who do attend to pick up your $30 share of the fee.

Please see Terry's website below for location, credentials, info about the facilities, etc.   This was a very successful series when we did it last year and I hear that participants took advantage of refreshments afterwards at Cafe Escadrille right around the corner!


Any questions, please contact me by clicking on my profile and select message to send a private email

http://www.bigsticksgolf.com/home/about-us/

Color Healing Training (Attunement & Certificate Included)

Wonder why you are drawn to certain colors?

Want to learn how colors can shift energy or emotions?

Interested in incorporating colors in your healing sessions to help balance chakras and heal physically?

Color healing was one of the first modalities Trisha explored over 20 years ago. She combines her studies in art, Bachelor's Degree in Interior Design and experience in Color Healing to offer you this fun and intriguing workshop that will help you HEAL YOUR LIFE WITH COLOR!

Each color has its own energy, healing qualities, temperature, vibration, and subconscious language. Learn how to use color to: incorporate into reiki healings;  heal the physical body; balance chakras; change your environment; shift your mood;  and portray a specific side of yourself to others. Learn which colors are best to aid fever or pain; lessen depression and anxiety; open psychically and lots more! Color Meditations and Hands-on Color Healings will be practiced in class. Includes booklet, attunement, and certificate.

results.description:
HIIT is a training technique in which you give 100% effort through quick, intense bursts of exercise, followed by short, and sometimes active recovery. You will burn more fat and calories in the 24 hours after a HIIT workout than you do after a steady-pace run.

Weight loss studies have shown that both weight training and HIIT workouts allow you to preserve hard-earned muscle while ensuring most of the weight lost comes from fat stores. It also stimulates the production of your human growth hormone (HGH) which not only increases your metabolism but slows the aging process.


Stop by the studio every Monday at 6:30 p.m. and get your HIIT on!!

Instructor:  Certified Personal Trainer  - Domenic or Stephan


Class Limit:  15

545 Main Street, Reading, MA 01867

results.description:
Plenty of parking in the rear. Drive through the archway. 10 minute walk from redline Porter Square.

The restaurant is business casual. Very unique and beautiful with brick and arches. This is a monthly speaker event.

With about 45 people, we first mingle and talk over drinks (and apps). Then we sit at tables of six or more. Dinner is served. Then the speaker starts.

Dr. Sara Freedman

She will talk about the following: "Many of us grew up learning that the South was the bastion of slavery while the North was the home of abolitionism. New scholarship and current events complicate this picture, particularly the role the North played in supporting the development and extension of slavery during the colonial and antebellum periods. In this talk, Sara Freedman will examine the ways in which slavery as an institution and its day-to-day reality permeated the economic, cultural, moral and social life in the North, particularly in Massachusetts."


As a long time high school and graduate school educator including at the Harvard Institute for Learning in Retirement, Dr. Freedman has led many discussion based courses exploring new topics in U.S. labor and social history. She first became interested in the topic of her talk while attending a National Park Service conference in Lowell in 1993.


About the Dinner: Usually about 20 to 35 people composed of members and meetup invitees. Social Hour: 6:30 p.m. Dinner: 7 p.m. Speaker : Around 8 p.m. You can come at any time.

RISTORANTE GRAN GUSTO

Exterior and interior of building. Lots of brick and tromp l'oeil. Very Italian. We have negotiated two reduced (!) price dinners. However if neither of these suit you you can order separately from their menu or not at all! The two dinner choices are: A many(!) course Italian dinner at $36.00 or a pizza, appetizer, salad and dessert dinner at $24.00. (The pizza is real authentic Italian pizza!) (tip included!) Or you can join the club and pay less per dinner!

Drinks can be ordered from the bar.
results.name: Dinner and History---Slavery in the North!

New players VERY welcome:

We will teach you how to play.

The 50 cent charge is totally voluntary and is only to approximately cover the meetup charge, however It is suggested that you buy a drink or something else there, to compensate the hosting establishment.

Menu:

http://www.bertuccis.com/?gclid=CMi-r4DA-sgCFZGRHwodTLIMaw#menu


A drink meal and tip could be $20 - $30

New people are very welcome and will probably will play their first few hands, about an hour of instruction, with the Meetup organizer and selected players before playing at-large with the rest of the group.

This is SOCIAL CARDS conversation is encouraged, however please be aware of when it is your turn to bid or play a card, we try to keep the fun balanced and considerate of everyone between the two activities.


https://www.google.com/maps/@42.4836419,-70.905886,17z?hl=en


Swampscott Mall, near Salem-Swampscott line on route 1A

Same lot as Stop and Shop next to Walgreen's.

Now alternating Mondays and Wednesdays! We have space set aside at Common Ground in Arlington Center (319 Broadway in Arlington). The food there is great and the management is really looking forward to us becoming regulars. We'll be at the tables closest to the front windows. Bring your favorite games and get ready for a fun evening!

Parking: There's a smallish 2 hour parking lot in front of the restaurant, and they stop checking at 8pm, so if you get one of those spots you should be safe all night. Parking on adjacent Medford St. Is 1 hr parking and parking is available at Arlington Catholic High, also on Medford St., for $3, but there's probably more 2 hr parking on other side streets.

Age Restriction: This meetup is intended for adults so we do ask that you be 18 or older to attend.  If there is enough interest we are discussing a possible "kid friendly" game night to be scheduled on different days.  Your feedback is always appreciated.

Dear Kizomba fans,

You heard about kizomba and you even tried couple classes here and there, now we have a perfect class for you!!

You are new to kizomba, wondered what it is, heard a bit about it , now is the time to give it a try....KIZOMBA.

SIGN UP in advance and SAVE $20!! OF 8 WEEK PROGAM HERE * online at http://movesandvibes.com/schedule/

If you are brand new to Kizomba then this is the time to get started. if you're not too sure about it then this is the time to find out for yourself. If you've been to a few classes then this is what you've been waiting for. Come find out why everyone is so excited.

- Professionally developed Kizomba instruction program created by world renowned dancer Manuel 'Dr Kizomba' Dos Santos.
- A series of classes that will follow a progression from week 1 till 8, covering the timing, rhythm and accent of the dance
- Exciting features include learning the unique connection, body motion and dips of Kizomba!
- Being a program as opposed to a 'drop in' class we will be able to progress together through the weeks, mastering the feeling and art of Kizomba
- Most of all its going to be filled with fun, excitement, jokes and smiles! lets do this

* Find out more info and buy your pass to the 8 week program online at http://movesandvibes.com/schedule/
* Alternatively, contact Inna Dançarina to pay in person.

This program is only $100 for 8 classes, making it one of the most affordable dance programs anywhere. And you can save $20 on top o that if you sign up in advance!

Its about inclusiveness not exclusiveness, we cant wait to share this beautiful art with you!!

Moves and Vibes team!

results.description:
Join us for a guided meditation to help you achieve a state of well-being, relaxation, and strengthen your connection to self. 

Each week, Elaine & Nicol alternate leading the group in a guided meditation to induce a deepened state of relaxation, healing on all levels.  You can achieve an expanded state of self and a higher state of consciousness, connecting you to the ALL that IS! 

Elaine and Nicol are able to connect with the most highest vibrations and frequencies of light that serves the group as a whole.  Your personal experience will be enhanced by the group setting. 

All levels of meditators are welcome to join us.  A sacred space is created to help you feel safe and comfortable. 

Please RSVP your intention on attending.  Cost is $5 at the door.  Doors open at 6:45pm with the group staring at 7pm!

results.description:
Scandinavia has chosen a mixed economic system that reduces the gap between the rich and the poor through redistributive taxation, while preserving the benefits of capitalism. Out of 153 countries, Sweden ranks 4th in equality, the USA ranks 92nd! The American dream is now alive and well in the Nordic countries and quickly vanishing in America. Was Sanders right in pointing to Denmark as a model to follow? Or was Clinton right in saying that it is unfair to compare a relatively small, homogenous country to America?

What the Scandinavians have learnt is, that there is strength in numbers. A large portion of the population is taxed at a high rate, not just high-income earners. In other words, if we want to imitate Scandinavia, we need to raise taxes most on the non-rich! Who would have thought that our tax system is more 'social' than in the Nordic countries!

But people are happy with this because they get a lot for it in return: free education, free health care, excellent infrastructure, paid maternity leave, you name it.. Even though this is also the case in America, since we pay less, we receive less. The Nordic countries also get a free ride by not spending a lot on their military and probably less on innovation, which are both much higher in the States.

On the other hand, while income tax and sales tax are high, corporate taxes are lower and Sweden doesn't even have an inheritance tax. Scandinavia has made sure that capital remains within its borders.

This is a smart way to generate revenue because it both stimulates business while still reigning in the excesses of capitalism, which inherently creates inequality.

For further reading and viewing, please go to: Sweden's March Towards Capitalism: Economist Andreas Bergh on the "Capitalist Welfare State" 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vG51uCrYxVM

How Scandinavian Countries Pay for Their Government Spending (http://taxfoundation.org/blog/how-scandinavian-countries-pay-their-government-spending)

Rise of Scandinavia "What in the World" !


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rH1S8wgjum0
results.name: The Nordic Model: Why Cannot we be more like Scandinavia?

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) at 7 PM.  We usually wait a few minutes for people to show and make introductions, but if you arrive later and miss us at the table,  check the small whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what the Event Host (see RSVP list) is wearing that day, and come find us on the walls.  Don't be shy, make an effort to ask around and find the group; we're all friendly.  We usually climb until 9-9:30-ish, but if you'd like to secure partner(s) who can come earlier or stay later, feel free to post to the comment section below.

(NOTE: In the very rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive by 7, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing (if you are interested in both). For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Basic Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from cubbies, if available).

Why join a men's circle? Some of the benefits of The Surround include: - Building unconditional connections and friendships.- Exploring the key aspects of being a man in a mature and open conversation.- Creating and supporting one another in fulfilling our intentions.- Improving relationships in all areas of life.- Changing old behaviors and beliefs that limit life.- Learning what we were not taught growing up.- Enjoying a safe, open, and honest space.

The mission of The Surround is to connect men and explore the experience of being a man today so that men are free and powerful to contribute to their families, their communities, and the world. Have you ever considered joining a men's community? Please come and experience The Surround.

All men are welcome, there are no restrictions. Participation at your first 2 meetings is free. On-going participation at a reasonable monthly or annual cost.

results.description:
Hackers and Hustlers: 30 Minute Networking Session followed by Three 20 minute Concept discussions (email me if interested in featuring your concept as part of this discussion: [masked])

Last Meetup exceeded expectations. More people showed up than we planned for - which was great!  3 entrepreneurs presented ideas ranging from a more engaging live streaming experience -- to applications of the free software movement -- to Deep Packet Inspection. 

The Core Mission of this group is to facilitate a connection between the two core personas needed to create a successful technology startup: the Hacker and the Hustler. 

Bring your ideas, find inspiration for an idea, help others refine their ideas, and find your future co-founder. 

Hackers: If you are a software engineer, coder, designer, architect and/or general tech geek and are looking to meet someone to partner with to formulate a business plan and handle the business side of things, this meetup is for you. 

Hustlers: If you are a business oriented thinker - marketing, sales, finance, deal maker etc. and are looking to meet someone to partner with to handle the technology side of things, this meetup is for you. 

Who this meetup is not for: Close-minded thinkers. 

Who this meetup is for: Technology and Business entrepreneurs looking to discuss ideas, network, and meet their future co-founder. 

Meeting Format: Each meeting we will begin with a 30 minute networking session, followed by three business or technology concept discussions. The concept discussion can be a business plan, technology / design concept, or problem / opportunity that you believe could be a potential business. Really anything that you would like to discuss in a structured format with the group at large. You will have 5 minutes to explain your topic, and the group will engage in a brainstorm for 15 minutes. 

If you would like to submit a concept to be one of the three that are discussed, please email me prior to the meeting at [masked].
results.name: Discuss Startup Concepts, Meet your Co-Founder

results.description:
Notice the change of day for this particular event: Monday.  We are going to try to do some of the Tuesdays at Adam's house (with a Monday event at my house this same week).  Hopefully we get more gaming options and more people can participate in at least one of the events.


===========


Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.
results.name: Board Games in Sudbury

results.description:
{When making decisions, consult not just your rational brain but your entire "inner board of directors" -- the heart, the gut, the head, and the whole self -- using a mind-body tool developed by the presenter, body psychotherapist Linda Marks.} 

Our Topic This Evening

When we make decisions, our rational brain is a key resource, but not our only resource. Do you ever act on gut feel? Have you noticed that following your heart is important for peace and happiness? 

In tonight's workshop, we will practice using a mind-body tool that body psychotherapist Linda Marks has developed for integrated mind-body decision making: the inner board of directors. The board members are the head, heart and gut, with the whole self as the chairman of the board. 

This useful technique can be applied to simple and fun daily tasks like "what do I want for lunch?" and also to larger scale and farther reaching questions like "what is my next professional direction?" or "for me to be happy, what choices must I make?"


Join us for an enriching evening!

To Prepare ....

1)  Do you ever find yourself having a hard time making a decision because of a conflict between what you think you should do and what you really want to do?
2) How do you make small decisions?
3) How do you make important decisions?

Our Leader This Evening

Linda Marks, MSM, is a body-centered psychotherapist, lifework counselor, social architect, author, and singer/songwriter.  Through her work with individuals, couples and groups and her personal example, she helps others heal from the soul level up and create new heartfull possibilities for their lives. 


Emotional-safety is a cornerstone for her work, integrating emotional and physical heart health.

A pioneer in her field, she co-founded the first state body psychotherapy professional association in the U.S. in 1988.  She has been committed to founding organizations that bridge the gap between the individual and the collective for the past 30 years. 

She holds degrees from Yale and MIT.  Linda is the founder of the Institute for Emotional-Kinesthetic Psychotherapy, offering body psychotherapy training using an apprenticeship model, the Boston Area Sexuality and Spirituality Network, and served on the faculty of the College for Community and Public Service at UMass Boston.  She is a founding member of the United States Association for Body Psychotherapists.

Linda is the author of hundreds of articles and two books: 
- Living with Vision 
- Healing the War Between the Genders

You can reach her at [masked].

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies:

Please come and help author Joel Karlinsky to evolve this script into a truly final draft.  He has worked long and hard on it and it has placed in several prestigious contests.  NOTE:  this is the review that was postponed from March 21st.


Log line: 

A reluctant ne’er-do-well apprentice wins the love of a princess and finds the father he never had by constructing a magic hourglass that saves her kingdom from her evil half-brother.

About the Author: 


Joel is a graduate of MIT with a degree in Aero and Astro Engineering and another in Life Sciences. He earned an MD at Tufts and an MBA at Boston University as well as a Certificate in Screenwriting from UCLA. Currently, Joel is a Professor of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine
at Boston University School of Medicine.  He has been a member of HSSW for ten years and has written ten full-length features, mostly comedic. One of his features, Zombie Cop, was a winner of the 2015 Stage 32 New Blood Contest, and was stage-read at the Central Square Theatre in Cambridge, MA in 2014.

Meeting at 66 Winthrop Street, Cambridge.  Dues, as always, $15.00.

Meeting will be run by Paul Falcone as Genine Tillotson is on medical leave until after April 11th.

results.description:
Tema di discussione: Il cambiamento climatico. Cosa fa' l'Italia?

Alcuni dati: Negli ultimi 60 anni il livello di CO2  ha superato sostanzialmente i livelli registrati storicamente 

http://climate.nasa.gov/evidence/ ;

Come e’ strutturata la serata? 

• Mezz’ora per salutarci e ordinare cena (Di norma ci incontriamo per cena)

• Un’ora di discussione sul tema di discussione 

• Un’ora di discussione su temi vari di piu’ recente cronaca proposti dai partecipanti 

• Varie ed eventuali 

Quali sono le regole per la discussione? 


1.  Apprezzare la diversita’ di idee


2.  Basare la discussion su fatti e numeri 

3.  Sforzarsi di capire il punto di vista degli altri 

4.  Criticare i fatti e le politiche, non le persone o i politici 

5.  Dare a tutti la possibilita' di parlare 

6.  Promuovere un clima di amicizia 

(Adattato da: http://ctb.ku.edu/en/table-of-contents/lead...)
results.name: Discussione: Il cambiamento climatico. Cosa fa' l'Italia?

results.description:
Hey Security of Things MeetUp members. As I mentioned at our event last week, I'm chairing a panel on securing IoT at next week's Connected Things Conference at the MIT Media Lab. Connected Things is hosted by the MIT Executive Forum and is a must-attend event if you're interested in the intersection of commerce, technology and the IoT. 

The goal of last year’s conference was to bring clarity to a topic where there is still a lot of uncertainty. This year, Connected Things is "getting real" with IoT and focusing on what’s real and happening today—at scale—with IoT.


Thanks to our friends at the Forum, there is a special (HUGE!) discount for Security of Things MeetUp Members: 

<a>Go to the event registration page</a> and use the coupon code SOTMEETUP and get a non-member ticket for less than half the face value: $95 versus $195!  
Note: the Coupon code gets applied all the way at the end of the transaction so don't get confused - you will see the discount before you submit the registration.  


This discount expires on April 1 so that they can be ready for the event, so hop on over and get your discount. 


My panel discussion is at 4:25 pm and is called "IoT Security Gets Real." I'll be joined on stage by Louis Parks, President and CEO, SecureRF Corporation, John Walsh, President, Sypris Electronics LLCWilliam Whyte,  Chief Scientist, Security Innovation. 

Best, 

Paul
results.name: April 5 Connected Things Conference at MIT (Discount for MeetUp Members)

results.description:
The ‘Best Bargain in Boston’ - SOLD OUT!        Please join us in 2017. 

Connected Things 2016 takes place on the top floor of the MIT Media Lab in Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA  USA. Hear from four wonderful keynote speakers, eleven panels covering a wide variety of topics, and a neat array of tabletop exhibits.  AGENDA

Speakers from:  GE Healthcare, IBM, Air Canada, New Balance, Ericsson, Unisys, McKinsey, ChainLink Research, PTC, IDC, RetailNext, Boston Business Journal, Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Central Maine Healthcare, Greenwave Systems, Elemental Machines, U.S. Dept. of Veteran Affairs, Medullan, Mount Auburn Hospital, Boston VA Healthcare System, Harvard Medical School, Imprivata, SML Group, Temperature@lert, RAIN RFID Global Alliance, Boston Mayor’s Office of New Urban Mechanics, Mayor of New Bedford, Transportation Group - City of New Haven, CIMCON Lighting, Security Ledger, SecureRF Corporation, Sypris Electronics, Security Innovation, Digital Lumens, Analog Devices, ITAMCO, All Traffic Solutions, RR Donnelley, Cargo Aware, Swirl Networks, Raizlabs, Unacast, Location Based Marketing Association, MIT, Ingenu, Cyber Security Strategies, Office of Tech, Innovation and Entrepreneurship, Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

It’s all about finding solutions for ‘Things’.  What’s the best way to deal with the chaos and confusion of the clutter of things that permeate our everyday lives at work, on the road and at home?

There’s a strong surge in the adoption of smart, connected things. Over 5 billion RAIN tags were sold in 2015. Millions of new M2M cellular devices are being deployed each month. There are hundreds of companies offering all sorts of solutions including hardware, software, services, analytics and more.

The event begins at noon on April 5th and will be a great place to network with experts and others interested in the ‘Things’ space.

Unfamiliar with our events?  See a 2015 video of our event on Hyper-Local Mobile Marketing

Fred Gruhn

results.description:
Not a play. Not a movie. No, this is an opportunity for the members of the Boston Horror Society to get together for drinks, food, and socializing that is within walking distance of Boston Common. 

Thanks to the nice folks over at the Boston Sci-Fi & Fantasy Meetup Group, we will get to share their space over at M.J. O'Connor's, a popular restaurant / pub located on Columbus Ave. This is not only a great chance to meet people in the Horror group, but also people in the Sci-Fi/Fantasy group. Below is additional information about this event that was posted over at the Sci-Fi/Fantasy page.

More about M.J. O'Connor's here:

http://back-bay.mjoconnors.com/  Please keep in mind that there are a couple of M.J. O'Connor locations, we'll be at the Park Plaza location at 27 Columbus Ave. in Boston

LOGISTICS:

* There is no theme or agenda, just people talking about Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and geeky things that we like (and dislike). If you can't come on time, that's fine, we usually have a large group until 8:00 PM. M.J. O'Connors is open until 2am if you want to stay extra late, but they will open up the room to the public at 9:00pm. 

* If you have SciFi/Fantasy Books or DVDs that you don't want anymore, feel free to bring them to the meetup and give them away (no sales, please). Be sure to take home anything that isn't claimed before you leave! 

* There is no charge for this meetup, but the restaurant that hosts us greatly appreciates your business (and doesn't charge us a room rental fee), so please come hungry (or at least buy a drink). Also, please don't forget to pay your bill before you leave!

TRAVEL:

It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Park Street T stop (Red and green) and a five minute walk from either Arlington and the Boylston stops on the green line

There are pay parking lots around. For example, the Motor Mart Garage (motormartgarage.com) which is just around the block and is $10 for up to 3 hours, if you come in after 5pm.

There are some metered parking spots for the those willing to drive around and be patient, but only a few.

Update: If anyone wants to see a few pics of the space (which is all for us!) go here: http://www.meetup.com/boston-scifi/photos/15860992/

Hope to see you then!
results.name: Social Meetup at M.J. O'Connor's

results.description:
OPEN CARDS AND BOARD GAME NIGHT

ANTHING GOES TONIGHT - bring your board games, and your card games like Sorry, Yahtzee, Clue, Domino, Scrabble, Apple to Apples, Monopoly, Wizard, etc...

                        Tonight we'll play them all!

   Bring your decks of cards and let the games begin!

Come join the C&C crew over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford for a open cards and board game night.  There is always conversation and dinner first but then we can split up and play whatever there is.

Whether you prefer board games, card games or party games (or just want to meet people!), Tuesday nights will be your opportunity! We welcome  new additions to the group, and it's great to see new friendships being made over board games...

Although we start playing around 6:30pm or so, early birds (Before 6pm) can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street
