results.description:
Environmental Justice: Does access to safe drinking water depend on race and class?

Register ($12) HERE. 

Tuesday, April 5th, 6-8:30pm


Cambridge Innovation Center

The Venture Cafe - 1 Broadway (5th Floor), Cambridge

:: :: ::

In the unfolding tragedy of the Flint, Michigan water crisis, social and environmental justice issues are once again a critical focus for American citizens, who are concerned about environmental health and safety as well as environmental justice.

In April, BASG member, Arnold Sapenter, will moderate a panel discussing environmental justice and related social issues as they apply to Boston and Massachusetts.  The panel will talk about programs that exist in greater Boston to address environmental justice issues and the challenges and opportunities that exist here. In addition, they'll explore the connection between environmental justice and sustainability and lead our follow-on discussion. 

Arnold Sapenter, MBA, LEED GRA, is the recent Director of Sustainability and past Director of Diversity and Program Monitoring for the Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection. He has served on many advisory boards and committees including the Massachusetts Leading By Example Committee and the Advisory Committee for the Governor’s Diversity Initiative. As Director of Diversity and Program Monitoring Arnold Sapenter created and chaired the Cultural Diversity and Environmental Justice Committees for MassDEP from 1993 to 2003.


Sam Lipson is Director of Environmental Health for the Cambridge Public Health Department. He came to the CPHD in 1996 and established the Environmental Health Division in 1998. He has 20 years of experience in public health risk assessment, biological safety, environmental health policies and other environmental health sub-disciplines, and has served as a board member of the American Lung Association in Massachusetts, Mass. With cooperation from Harvard and MIT faculty and staff at the Museum of Science, Sam has staged a series of local air quality studies in Cambridge that have utilized community volunteers and graduate students to examine pervasive air quality. 

Rebecca Herst is Senior Clilmate Project Manager at UMass Boston and the Boston Harbor Association. She will join us to talk about The Boston Harbor Association's work on climate resillance for highly vulnerable harbor communities.

If your organization is interested in co-hosting this event or a future BASG event, please contact carolbaroudi[at]bostonareasustainability.org.
results.name: Water, Race & Class

You should sign up for the sessions independently because the lessons are not going to build on the previous week--however, we ask that to be fair to everyone, please sign up for a maximum of 2 sessions to start out until everyone's had a chance to sign up.

results.description:
For today’s entrepreneur - who faces high hurdles to funding, ever increasing competition, thin barriers to entry, and shortened cycles from invention - strategic alliances and partnerships have become a key survival technique. For the startup company, your strategic partner can be your first source of outside funding, the beta tester of your product or service, and source of credibility for your first angel or venture capital investment round. For the early stage company, alliance partners can help you to gain competitive advantages, increase sales, scale up production, penetrate new markets and deliver new products and services. The strategic alliance partner, might also offer more… the potential for an exit strategy, the potential acquirer for your company or one to lead you to a future acquisition.

On April 5, our ENET panel will include present and past CEOs, investors and Merger and Acquisition (M&A) professionals, moderated by a startup company and M&A attorney. All have extensive experience developing and building these alliances to deliver value and to aid companies for future M&A events and for their exit strategies. They will tell what to look for and what to avoid as they : (1) address the process of identifying possible partners, drilling down to the best one and securing the relationship; (2) share experiences regarding what has made their partnerships successful, and, more importantly, what went wrong and why; (3) discuss how these relationships aided them in their M&A and exit strategies, (4) review the risks to their companies, and the learning process that they went through.

Panel:


Katherine Hays, co-founder and CEO of Vivoom, Inc. ( http://www.vivoom.co/ ) a mobile media company that enables brand-safe storytelling between advertisers and consumers. The company has built a platform that allows brands to put people at the center of their entire mobile marketing process. . Customers using Vivoom's platform include Citibank, General Mills, TCU, Universal Pictures, NCM, In the Pink for Lilly Pulitzer among others. Prior to Vivoom, Katherine served as CEO of GenArts from 2008 to 2015. While CEO, she more than doubled the company's number of high-end users and transitioned the company to a SaaS business model, and made acquisitions of wondertouch, UK-based SpeedSix, Ltd., and the Tinder business (formerly part of The Foundry). Katherine has a proven track record of launching media and technology companies including Massive Incorporated, the In-game advertising network she co-founded, ran as COO/CFO and eventually sold to Microsoft in 2006. Prior to Massive, Katherine was an equity research analyst with Goldman Sachs. She is a graduate of Princeton and Harvard Business School. Richard C. Kimball, Senior Director of Bigelow LLC ( http://www.bigelowllc.com/ ) for over twenty years, where he has built stockholder value in family-owned and owner-managed businesses, managing client relationships in distribution, technology, and service industries for U.S. and foreign clients. Kimball’s operating experience includes serving as Vice Chairman and Director of Rock of Ages Corporation, the nation’s leading quarrier and manufacturer of specialty granites and granite products. Prior to joining Bigelow, Dick served in a number of sales, marketing, and consulting positions with Universal Packaging, Unilever, and The U.S. Department of Commerce and The U.S. Department of State. Kimball has served on the Board of several public and private companies, including Merchants National Bank, Hollis Automation, and Advanced Systems Inc. He has been quoted in a number of publications including the American Bankers magazine, CFO magazine, The Boston Globe, and the Wall Street Journal. Dick is a graduate of Babson College, where he has served as Trustee for over 20 years, and has chaired several Babson Councils on Family Business, Entrepreneurship, and Global Business.

Charles R. Lax, Co-Founder and Managing General Partner of GrandBanks Capital, focusing on investments in Internet infrastructure, software and software services, security and storage applications, mobile media, financial technologies and services, and wireless technologies and services. Charley's investment career includes investments in 54 portfolio companies, which have resulted in 39 exits thus far. His track record includes 15 companies that went public, of which 10 achieved market caps in excess of $1 billion. The combined value of exits during Charley’s venture career has been over $6.1 billion which includes the $4.6 billion purchase of GeoCities by Yahoo!. Charley was recently named one of the top 50 venture capitalists on the east coast by AlwaysOn. Charley currently serves on the boards of a number of GBC companies, including; Defense Mobile, GlassHouse Technologies, KnowledgeVision, SilverRail Technologies and TIM Group. Charley is also a founding General Partner of SOFTBANK Venture Capital (established in 1997), an early-stage venture capital firm. Prior to his career in venture capital, Charley worked for a series of software companies in marketing, product management and sales roles, including Phoenix Technologies Ltd., the BIOS developer. Charley is a graduate of Boston University, B.S. magna cum laude, and currently serves on the Advisory Boards of Boston University Athletic Department and recently retired from the President’s Council of the Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering.  (http://www.grandbankscapital.com/ )

Moderator:

Robert Adelson, business and tax attorney, partner at Boston law firm of Engel & Schultz LLP, and Chairman of The Boston Entrepreneurs’ Network. Rob has been an attorney for over 30 years specialized in business, tax, stock and options, employment, contracts, financings, trademarks and intellectual property. Rob began as an associate at major New York City law firms before returning home to Boston in 1985 where he has since been a partner in small and medium sized firms before joining his present firm in 2004. Rob represents entrepreneurs, start-ups and small companies, independent contractors and employees and executives. Rob is a frequent speaker on business law topics and author of numerous articles published in Boston Business Journal, Mass High Tech and other publications. He has been named among the “Top 20 Boston Startup Lawyers” by ChubbyBrain.com, a website that provides tools for entrepreneurs. Rob has been on the ENET Board since 2002 and Chairman since 2009 and is also a Co-Founder and Board member of the 128 Innovation Capital Group. He holds degrees from Boston University, B.A., summa cum laude, Northwestern University (Chicago), J.D., Law Review, and New York University, LL.M. in Taxation. www.ExecutiveEmploymentAttorney.com
results.name: Strategic Alliances for M&A and Successful Exits

results.description:
Hardly a day goes by without some major computing security event – massive data breaches, new malware attacks, bogus tax filings, identity theft, theft of banking information, cyber attacks to our defense systems, attacks on the IoT and the list goes on. Bruce Tis will review the current state of security. Included will be a discussion of how computer security changed in 2015, the 5 biggest security failures of the year, the biggest data breaches, the top 10 malware attacks, the most innovative and damaging attacks, predictions for 2016, and what have we seen so far in 2016. Most important will be the lively discussion that ensues about attendees own experiences during the past year.

Our speaker is Bruce Tis, Ph.D. is an associate professor of computer science in the School of Library and Information Sciences at Simmons College.

(Meeting is free and open to all; please RSVP so we can make sure we have enough space and enough munchies; a light dinner is served and donations are optional.)
results.name: The Current State of Security

results.description:
Are you curious about programming or thinking about pursuing a career in software engineering? 

Then RSVP on this meet-up page for this 2-hour Intro to Coding class happening in the Boston area at CIC Boston. Learn the basics of programming, do hands-on exercises, and meet new people. All for free!

The class is being taught by MakerSquare, which runs some of the top coding schools in the country.

Class officially starts at 6:30pm, but please arrive at CIC Boston by 6:15pm to mingle with your fellow classmates and settle in. We will end at 9pm, with the last 30 minutes being an optional Q&A session.

What will I learn during the class?

This beginner ­level class will contain several instructor-guided exercises. The class will cover the following topics:

   1. Overview of programming 

   2. Intro to data & data structures

   3. Basics of functions

We ask that you read the Prerequisites section before the start of class and bring your own laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux) with Google Chrome installed.

What is MakerSquare Boston?

MakerSquare is a three-month full-time school for software engineering. By teaching computer science fundamentals and modern web languages like JavaScript, we prepare students to join top flight engineering teams.

We have campuses all over the country, and are excited to be opening a campus in Boston. The free Intro to Coding class is to introduce more people to the wonderful world of programming and to get the community excited about the launch of our full-time class in Boston in July 2016!

Questions? Email us at [masked].
results.name: Free Intro to Coding Class (Tues April 5, 6:30-9pm)

results.description:
Spend some time on your project by bringing it along to our weekly project night, an evening designed around you and what you're working on.

This weekly event is about finding time to tinker, being creative, and meeting other members of the community.  You'll get the chance to see what others are working on, share your projects, and to get inspiration and feedback from fellow tinkerers.

On any given Tuesday night you have people working on electronics, knitting, writing code, wood-working, or just their plans for world domination. Beer is also consumed.

We’ll provide: space to work, basic tools, power, a room full of like minded people.

You’ll provide: your project, ideas and beer (optional). A laptop would probably be useful too.

Sometimes we work on group projects together, which are usually set up as separate meetup events. Keep an eye on our events page to see what we’re working on next.

Find us: http://p.irateship.com/treasuremap.html

We're a group of friendly folks who just love playing and getting together on a regular basis.  Our skills range from advanced beginner through experienced, and we're happy to help a 'newbie' or two learn the game.  Please bring a set if you have one; everyone will also need their own mah jong card.  Note that we will be playing American-style Mah jong, which is slightly different from Chinese mah jong.  American-style requires a mah jong card and uses jokers.  

We'd like to start the games at 6:30 promptly; feel free to come early and grab a bite from the Wegmans' cafe.  I'm typically upstairs around 6:00 to eat, meet, and greet!

Hope to see you on Tuesday nights!

--Jill

results.description:
Hear from the author! Dan Ward will be coming to the #EMCdojo to present the basic principles and practices from his new book The Simplicity Cycle in a casual, interactive session. Participants are encouraged to ask questions, share stories, and explore how to apply the Simplicity Cycle on their own projects. & 5 lucky meetup-goers will get a free copy of the book! 

http://t2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTcPi8ERDdWy18Ulj6CvtCymiDoVW9qmEPl069QFi9cgqP1zfVG

Leveraging his experience as a military technologist Dan offers humorous and practical insights that show audiences how to navigate a complex environment and avoid complexity-related design pitfalls. His Simplicity Cycle diagram provides a powerful framework for making decisions about complexity and equips the audience with a visual vocabulary to foster effective discussions about simplicity with clients, colleagues, and customers.

BIO

Dan Ward is the author of F.I.R.E.: How Fast, Inexpensive, Restrained and Elegant Methods Ignite Innovation (HarperBusiness, 2014) and The Simplicity Cycle: A Field Guide To Making Things Better Without Making Them Worse (HarperBusiness, 2015).

Dan served for more than 20 years as an engineering officer in the US Air Force, where he specialized in leading high-speed, low-cost technology development programs and retired at the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. A popular conference speaker (SXSW, Lean Start Up, SAP Ariba Live, etc), Dan has also given guest lectures at universities in the US, UK, and South America. He testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee and the British House of Commons, and his expertise on innovation has been recognized by the White House. Dan’s writings have appeared in a variety of outlets including Fast Company, Forbes, Harpers, and The Boston Globe.

Dan holds three engineering degrees and received the Bronze Star Medal for his service in Afghanistan. He is a Senior Associate Fellow with the British Institute for Statecraft and a Non-Resident Cybesecurity Fellow with the New America Foundation. He lives in Massachusetts with his wife and two children.

Praise for The Simplicity Cycle

“If I could ask my clients to read one book before we work together, it would be The Simplicity Cycle by Dan Ward… It’s simply brilliant.” (Peter Morville, President of Semantic Studios.)

“In The Simplicity Cycle Dan Ward presents a straightforward graphical way of looking at design that is both easily grasped and profoundly enlightening.” (Henry Petroski, author of To Forgive Design and The House with Sixteen Handmade Doors)

“The Simplicity Cycle’s combination of powerful tools and memorable case studies makes it an essential addition to any innovator’s book shelf. (Scott Anthony, author of The Little Black Book of Innovation)
results.how_to_find_us: Google 145 Broadway, Cambridge MA. We are on the 3rd Floor. See you soon :)
results.name: The Simplicity Cycle: A Guide to Making Things Better Without Making Them Worse

results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

results.description:
Your primary job (yes - primary!) is "communicator". I truly believe that. Whether your title is data scientist, data analyst, data engineer...or plumber or electrician or street sweeper. Your first job in life is communications. Nothing you do exists or has any impact without the communication of it - to your boss, your colleagues, your customers... In this meetup, I'll talk about why communications is so critical and share some secrets to great data communications that you can use every day.

This meetup will be held on the Bentley University campus in Waltham in the Smith Academic Technology Center - Room 200.

You can see a campus map at this link:
http://bhv.io/bentleymap

results.description:
A few months ago, we discussed the global migration crises, the legal rights of migrants, and potential options Europe, in its case, had to balance its concerns against those rights. New developments persuade me that we should look at this topic again, focusing squarely on Europe.

On June 23, the UK is planning a referendum on whether it should continue its membership in the EU. In the meantime, several countries that are party to the Schengen agreement have introduced temporary border controls within the area. Open borders, of course, are one of the key facilitators of the single market. What will be the implications of a weakening of the Schengen Agreement? Can the EU survive "Brexit"? Let's discuss all this over some good food and drinks!
results.how_to_find_us: Call me at (617)583-3781, and I'll come and let you in. We'll most likely be at the cafe tables, rather than the lobby itself.. (There's a card swipe out there, and you'll need me to pass through.)
results.name: Monthly Salon: Migration II - Europe in Crisis

results.description:
Lama Willa's teaching will explore the eight worldly winds, eight worldly preoccupations that interfere with full human flourishing. The third pair of these involve our attachment to praise and fear of blame. When this habitual pattern is recognized, we are freed up develop equanimity in the face of the ups and downs of this human life. Join Lama Willa and the NDF Cambridge Sangha in person or via LiveStream (http://www.naturaldharma.org/live-teachings/)


Willa B. Miller, PhD is the Founder and Spiritual Director of Natural Dharma Fellowship in Boston, MA and its retreat center Wonderwell Mountain Refuge in Springfield, NH. She is an authorized dharma teacher and lineage holder (lama) in the Kagyu lineage of Tibetan Buddhism, but practices in the Nyingma and Shangpa lineages as well. She is editor, author and translator (respectively) of three books: The Arts of Contemplative Care: Pioneering Voices in Buddhist Chaplaincy and Pastoral Work (2012), Everyday Dharma: Seven Weeks to Finding the Buddha in You (2009), and Essence of Ambrosia (2005). In 2013, she received a doctorate from Harvard University in Religion, and is currently Visiting Lecturer in Buddhist Ministry at Harvard Divinity School. Her academic teaching interests include Tantra and the Body, Buddhism and Ecology, and Buddhist Contemplative Care, among other topics. Outside of academia, her teaching specialties include the body as a door to awakening, natural meditation (mahamudra), and heart-cultivation (lojong). She is interested in the practical integration of meditation into daily life, and has participated as an advisor in several scientific studies on meditation. Her teachers and guides have included Kalu Rinpoche, Dilgo Khentse Rinpoche, Khenpo Tsultrim Gyamtso Rinpoche, Lama Norlha Rinpoche, and others. She currently derives inspiration for her practice and teaching from Lama John Makransky, Anam Thubten and Tsoknyi Rinpoche. She lives in Arlington, MA with her husband and two dogs, and frequently visits Wonderwell Mountain Refuge.

Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than are signed up using this web site.
results.name: The Eight Worldly Winds: Praise and Blame with Lama Willa Miller

results.description:
Rojava is an area about the size of Connecticut in the Kurdish land along the Turkish and Syrian border. The women and men there are building an egalitarian society based at least in part on the writings of the late Murray Bookchin, a U.S. Anarchist. They are fighting against Isis and also against capitalist nations who oppose what they are doing. Their goal is not to establish a separate nation for the Kurds, but to build a grass-roots society of neighborhoods and communities that practice real egalitarianism including between the sexes (which is especially remarkable in that part of the world). For example, all major offices in Rojava are held by two individuals, one male and one female.


You can search on line for "Rojava" and several links will come up, including one to an article that appeared in the New York TImes Magazine last November. I recommend that you explore these to get some background information, which will enrich our discussion; but if you don't, that's fine and you are still welcome to come and participate!


We are very fortunate to have a speaker for this meetup with first-hand knowledge of current events in Rojava. He is Jonas Linde, a Swedish man who works with the Swedish Rojava Groups. Here is his own description of his work:


"Our goal is to build a clinic in the self-administrated socialist area of Rojava inside Syria, more precisely in the city of Kobane.
One of our first projects is going to be the sending of ambulances from Sweden to Rojava. our group is founded on the basis of socialism, feminism, antifacism and internationalism."

We will have an opportunity to listen to what Jonas has to say and then ask questions, make comments, and engage in a discussion.

I have invited several folks who are not members of B.A.E.R. to this meetup, all people who are interested in learning more about the topic, so be prepared to see some new faces!
results.name: Learn more about the egalitarian revolution in Rojava from someone involved!

results.description:
Please join us for a special, MBTA-flavored edition of hack night! At tonight's event, we'll be joined by Dominick Tribone  and Dave Barker of the MBTA for an update on the MBTA's APIs and how civic hackers can start using them to build apps, for data analysis, and anything else you can think of.

The MBTA’s real-time API is being extended to include calls that return quantitative performance metrics and historical performance data that can be used to analyze how well MBTA services are running, which we think will greatly expand the possible applications and analyses that can be done about the MBTA.


You can find out more about the API here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/massdotdevelopers/WH5gixgcHuM


Hope to see you there!


---


Our weekly work session will be at the Cambridge Innovation Center in Kendall Square, on the FOURTH FLOOR, in the CAFE. These Hack Nights are our time to meet in person to work on and discuss civic tech projects. Come by to say hi and hack with us!

Transportation
The Red Line stop for CIC is Kendall. For those who drive, there is a pay parking lot underneath the building, and limited meter parking in the area. Additionally, the MIT Hayward St lot is free after 5pm. Please make sure to check in with security when you arrive.

Schedule
7:00pm - Opening remarks, project updates, announcements
7:20pm - New member orientation
8:00pm - Hacking!

During the event, join our Hackpad for announcement links and collaborative note taking.

To ensure that Code for Boston is a welcoming space for all, staff and participants are held to our Code of Conduct.
results.name: Weekly Hack Night + MBTA Developer Event!

results.description:
A new TTR Worcester meetup? WHAT IS THIS ?!?!?!?!

For those who don't know, the Tabletopia platform is starting to open it's doors with it's "sorta kinda open beta" going on. It managed to get onto steam yesterday, and it will only pick up steam (excuse the pun) from there. So, I figured that it would be a good time to jump onto the bandwagon.

What is tabletopia?

It's a online board game platform featuring (currently) more than 200 board games to (virtually) play!

How do I Tabletopia?

Tabletopia is designed to be played via web browser (so no downloading is required!) Currently, it supports Firefox, IE, and Safari (Tabletopia uses Unity, which is why Chrome and Opera are currently unsupported.) It's also available currently on steam. In the future, they will also have a standalone app and iOS and Android support for mobile. Inviting someone else to a table is as easy as sharing a URL link!

For this first meetup, we will (most likely) use the meetup page as a initial check in point. When the event opens, there will be a link to a text chat room where we can go from there. We'll look at voice chat at a later point.

Can my computer handle Tabletopia?

Required specs are here: http://help.tabletopia.com/knowledge-base/system-requirements/

Is Tabletopia Free?

TL;DR: Yes. If you show, you will be able to play games.

Long answer: Currently, the system is in Semi-Closed beta. In order to get access to the library, you need to pay 10$ (which goes toward your first subscription once it officially launches.) However, once a room is opened, the owner can invite anyone, INCLUDING people who don't have access. In other words, only one person in each game played has to "own" Tabletopia, and everyone else is OK. In the future, if we have a lot of people, and there aren't many with tabletopia access, we may run into problems, but as of right now there's shouldn't be that much demand to cause problems.

Is there a chat room availible?

Tabletopia does have in game text chat. I'm not sure if it's possible to have a "non-game room" where people can just talk. If for some reason I can't, we'll use this meetup page as a chatroom worst case. Future meetups may use a voice chatroom (skype-like) to make things easier.

***A Social Fun favorite!***



Let’s go back to Brother’s Kouzina in Peabody, MA
for a Tuesday night dinner.

Located just 15 minutes from Boston on Route 1 North in Peabody, Brother’s Kouzina offers traditional Greek dishes as well as a wide array of Mediterranean food. Menu selections are prepared with ingredients that exemplify freshness and flavor. Brother’s Kouzina offers an elegant yet relaxed setting for our guests to enjoy their meals. Our family has created a comfortable atmosphere that will make our guests seem as if they are members of our family. The authentic Greek recipes that we’ve applied, has allowed us to serve exceptional food.

Jimmy, who is the original founder of the Brother’s Deli Restaurants, has been preparing classic Greek dishes for over 40 years. At the age of 18 he opened his first restaurant in his hometown of Kalamata Greece. He has a long history of serving traditional Greek food in the Boston area since his first American based restaurant in 1972. The number one goal for Jimmy and the rest of the Christopher family, has always been to serve the best quality food.

Dinner menu: http://www.brotherskouzina.com/index.html

Check out their new website at:http://www.brotherskouzina.com/index.html

Very easy to get to off Route 1 in Peabody.(Route 1 North) 25 Newbury Street Peabody, MA. Everyone is in charge of their own bill/tip and I will try to arrange that we have separate checks. Please do not take up a spot unless you know you can attend. I will have a waiting list.

I am keeping the attendance to 15 since that always works out to a more social dinner and people can talk more. I will have a wait list.

Driving only: Not T accessible.

Snow cancels/reschedules

See you there!

results.description:
The first Snowplow Meetup Boston will kick off at 6.30pm. We have three talks confirmed so far:

1. Yali Sassoon, from Snowplow Analytics, will be giving a quick overview of the Snowplow pipeline today and a peak at the roadmap for 2016

2. Ty Wilson, from CustomMade, a long time Snowplow user, will be talking about analysing user journeys and performing A/B testing with Snowplow

3. Robert Johnson, from Carbonite, another long-time Snowplow user, will be giving an overview of how Snowplow is used at Carbonite

A fourth talk is still to be finalised.

The event should be interesting to anyone doing event analytics, using Snowplow and/or thinking about using Snowplow. Previous events (in London, Amsterdam, Sydney, Berlin, Budapest, San Francisco) have attracted a mix of data analysts, scientists, engineers, marketers and product managers, and the discussions around the talks have been super interesting.

Pizza and beer / hard cider will be served.

Big thanks to all the above speakers, and especially the Carbonite team for hosting the event! Please can you make sure to sign up in advance with your full name: this will be necessary to get into the building. (The list will be given to security ahead of the meet.)

Looking forward to seeing you all there!

results.description:
Hey guys, lets have another great night of trivia! This event is always a success and everyone meets new friends!

A lot of Meetup groups join this event so we will set up tables reserved for meetup! We will help you split up into teams of 2-6 if you aren't putting together a team :)


When: Tuesday, April 5

Time: 7-9pm

Where: Lansdowne Pub, Fenway

Price: Free!


General Information: Remember the days of Family Feud? Well those days are back! And this time, with adult beverages! Form a crew with teammates past/present and/or other friends or come as an individual for some fun competition! Get those brain synapses charged up and join us for this great event!


THE TRIVIA Because there are more than 2 “families” coming this night, the trivia works in reverse of how traditional Family Feud scoring goes. All teams are given the survey questions that people were asked, and then you have to guess the answers given. You get MORE points for guessing the lower answers (the ones that only a few people said) and LESS points for guessing the most popular answers! So the challenge lies in guessing the toughest answer!


We will have awesome prizes for the winning team as well as other categories.

results.description:
Let's join the Greater Boston Divorced and Separated Support Group for:

How do you make good decisions and effectively buy and sell houses in a crazed market? What real estate myths are true, and which ones aren't? How can you increase your buying power? How can you decrease the total cost of ownership of a house? Where are the bargains? What's really important about the structure and utilities of the house (hint: it's not about the roof.). How can you maximize your homeowning dollars by keeping your costs low over your entire ownership.

Ok, now you're on your own, without your ex's income, advice, collaboration and savvy (if any). What are you going to do?
In this series of five seminars, we'll cover various aspects of your financial life, with the idea of putting you back in control and able to find the right advice, and make the right decisions.

The first seminar will be on your real estate. Should you buy? should you sell? Should you stay put? Should you rent? If you must sell, how can you do it right and obtain the best price for your house? What are the tax ramifications? What are some strategies for buying out your spouse and keeping the house? How an you buy another house with confidence?

Do you need a broker? If so, what kind? what is exclusive buyer brokerage? 

Ron Rothenberg, CFP (Certified Financial Planner) and real estate Exclusive Buyer Broker will be our featured speaker. 

Future seminars will be about taxation, retirement, investments, and understanding your divorce settlement.
results.name: Financial Seminar: Effective Home Buying & Selling Strategies in a Crazy Market

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for intermediate level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.



If you'd like to play, please do the following:


1. Send an email to Kory using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=8675200

2. In the message please indicate the date of event and your preferred position so we can make sure we have the right mix. ( If I don't know your position already)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters,  and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the Orient Heights Community Center located at 86 Boardman Street in East Boston. Kory and Wing will be hosting these Tuesday night volleyball meetups.

This event is free if you are a member of Boston Community Centers. If not, it's a one-time $20 membership fee that is valid for a year. The Community Center is a short walk away from the Orient Heights T Stop on the Blue Line and also has plenty of parking. When you drive up, turn at the Mariott Hotel Sign and park in the lot or further along the fence.

As always, please remember:

- Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP)

- The gym is open before the event to warm up, so please arrive a little early if you would like to warm up and stretch as we would like to start the game promptly from 7:00PM

- If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join.  Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.

results.description:
{Explore how a small change in your morning routine might lead to gigantic breakthroughs in your most important goals.  Derek Schwarz will overview the book "The Miracle Morning" and lead us in exercises to craft a morning that supports achieving miracles for our lives. - DP}    


Our Topic This Evening We Will learn how to begin each day accelerating our personal growth.

What if we could wake up tomorrow and quickly and easily transform any area of our life?  What would we create for ourselves? 

The Miracle Morning is already transforming the lives of tens of thousands of people around the world by showing them how to start each day with more energy, motivation, and focus, taking lives to the next level. Our presenter tonight will show us how a simple morning practice can bring our dreams to life.

It’s time to wake up our full potential…

The Miracle Morning

Derek will share key aspects of "one of the most life changing books ever written" -- showing us a simple approach to achieving what we went -- quickly.

“Hal Elrod is a genius and his book The Miracle Morning has been magical in my life. What Hal has done is taken the 'best practices'—developed over centuries of human consciousness development—and condensed the 'best of the best' into a daily morning ritual. A ritual that is now part of my day.”
-- Robert Kiyosaki, author of Rich Dad Poor Dad

We will explore:
- Dedicating a short amount of time each day to becoming the person we want to be.
- Making personal development a priority in our daily life. 
- Consistently attracting, creating, and sustaining the success we want.
- Utilizing a simple tool to create the life we want.

A Key: Focus Your Morning

We know the things that make us happy but we don't do those things. Why? Simple, we make ourselves too busy. If we want our lives to be different, we have to do something change what we are doing.

Think of the first hour of each day as the rudder of the day. What you first each day is your highest leveraged; it sets your mind and sets your context for the rest of your day.

Derek will share with us the philosophy and specific strategies to begin each day by investing in your full potential.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1sqhxl7hHSE&3m22s

To Prepare ....

1) Why do you currently get up in the morning?

2) What personal growth practices that you enjoy have you let slip away?

3) What personal growth practices have you always wanted to try but have never gotten around to do them?

4) How would making personal growth a consistent daily practice affect all areas of your life?  

Our Leader This Evening

Derek Schwarz is a PGN organizer, a personal growth adventure retreat leader, and a coach. He is certified in applied positive psychology through the Flourishing Center and is a graduate of both Tony Robbins Business Mastery and Mastery University.

As a user experience designer his spends his days designing optimal experiences for people. He applies his professional experience design expertise to help empower other's to design their own dream life experiences.

Derek's approach combines personal growth and living in peak states. He believes that progress is the ultimate motivation. He has found that a daily morning ritual is the surest way to ensure consistent progress and progress = happiness. 

The Miracle Morning has transformed all areas of Derek's growth since adopting it into his daily routine. Seeing the remarkable impact The Morning Miracle has had on him and others, Derek is excited to share this miracle with you so you can experience your own morning miracle and transform your life before 8am.

results.description:
Two-fer Tuesday: The Lady In The Van
When: April 5, 2016 @ 7:35 pm
Where: The Luna Theater - Mill No. 5, 250 Jackson Street, Lowell, MA 01852, USA

Cost: $8/9.75 (Get 2 tickets for the price of 1 on Tues)
TRAILER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VxBJTjV3DbE

Directed by Nicholas Hytner
Starring Maggie Smith, Alex Jennings, Jim Broadbent
English
1 hr 43 mins, rated PG-13

Alan Bennett’s story is based on the true story of Miss Shepherd (played by a magnificent Maggie Smith), a woman of uncertain origins who “temporarily” parked her van in Bennett’s London driveway and proceeded to live there for 15 years.

What begins as a begrudged favor becomes a relationship that will change both their lives. Filmed on the street and in the house where Bennett and Miss Shepherd lived all those years, acclaimed director Nicholas Hytner reunites with iconic writer Alan Bennett (The Madness of King George, The History Boys) to bring this rare and touching portrait to the screen.

* ABOUT THE LUNA: The Luna Theater is located on the 4rth floor of Mill No. 5. You need to go thru the iron gates and tunnel ( it's not a real tunnel) , take the elevator to the 4rth floor. The theater is down the hallway. There are signs to point the way. The theater has comfy seats - you can purchase beer, wine, soda, water, etc. and snacks. You can also stop in a Coffee & Cotton - beverages/food purchased there may be brought into the theater.

*PARKING: on street ( free in the evening) & garage
PLEASE: NO NEED TO REPLY "NO" IF NOT INTERESTED IN GOING. THANKS

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
We are meeting every Tuesday night from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM practicing Modern Arnis, WC, and SCJ flow drills and Self-Defense skills.

All levels are welcome!  For ages 15 and up.


The price is $15.00 /per person /per meetup. The first meetup is free.

Please wear loose fitting, comfortable cloths suitable for working out.

Please do not wear shoes that you've worn outdoors on the wood floor.



Instructor's Background

Alix Lavaud has been training Martial Arts for over 45 years and is a master of Modern Arnis, Pien San Wing Chun Kung Fu, and has extensive training in Small Circle Jujitsu.  He also humbly owns the rank of Lakan Apat (a 4th degree BLACKBELT ).


Lineage

Modern Arnis :  Remy Presas  -->  Alix Lavaud

Wing Chun:  Henry Mui  -->  Alix Lavaud

Small Circle Jujitsu:  Wally Jay -->  Alix Lavaud


Philosophy

 Go With The Flow ...

Some Quotes we Love

“If your mind is empty, it is ready for anything. In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few”
― Shunryu Suzuki


“Everything is perfect and there is always room for improvement.”
― Shunryu Suzuki

“We must exist right here and right now!”
― Shunryu Suzuki

Benefits of Martial Arts

1.  Mental Benefits

2.  Improved Balance

3.  Improved Flexibility

4.  Focus and stillness

5.  Hand and Eye Coordination

6.  Improved reflexes

7.  Learn self-defense skills

8.  Stress relief

9.  Relax

10.  Gain Self Confident and Self Respect

11.  Learn to Breathe

12.  Learn to Find Focus and Stillness

13.  Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution

14.  Improvement in many other Areas of Life

results.description:
Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform. 

Apache Apex (incubating) is a next generation native Hadoop big data platform. This talk will cover details about how it can be used as a powerful and versatile platform for big data. 

Presenter : Pramod Immaneni Apache Apex (incubating) PPMC member, committer and senior architect at DataTorrent Inc, where he works on Apex and specializes in big data applications. Prior to DataTorrent he was a co-founder and CTO of Leaf Networks LLC, eventually acquired by Netgear Inc, where he built products in core networking space and was granted patents in peer-to-peer VPNs. Prior to that he was a technical co-founder of a mobile startup where he was an architect of a dynamic content rendering engine for mobile devices. 

Please register for Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/982726273838015748


After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

results.description:
Register for IOT Big Data Ingestion & Analytics using Apache Apex - A Native Hadoop Platform at: https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/191501

Internet of Things (IoT) devices are becoming more ubiquitous in consumer, business and industrial landscapes. They are being widely used in applications ranging from home automation to the industrial internet. They pose a unique challenge in terms of the volume of data they produce, and the velocity with which they produce it, and the variety of sources they need to handle. The challenge is to ingest and process this data at the speed at which it is being produced in a real-time and fault tolerant fashion. Apache Apex is an industrial grade, scalable and fault tolerant big data processing platform that runs natively on Hadoop. In this webinar, you will see how Apex is being used in IoT applications and also see how the enterprise features such as dimensional analytics, real-time dashboards and monitoring play a key role. .

Presented by 
Pramod Immaneni, Principal Architect at DataTorrent, and PPMC member Apache APex

Ian Gomez, Audience Marketing Manager at DataTorrent

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Wednesday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Do something different for lunch! Join us for a fun, informative walk with the plants along the Charles!

There are over 40 different species of medicinal plants growing along the Charles River between Harvard Square and Central Square!

The ability to identify and use each of these plants was once commonplace to every man, woman, and child, but today most of us have lost that knowledge. Come reclaim what’s yours! Join us regularly throughout the spring, summer, and early fall and learn the plants in all of their stages of growth. By the end of these sessions, you’ll feel confident in your ability to identify the plants along the river – and you’ll how you can work with them!

Wednesday, April 6th, 2016
12:15pm – 1:15pm

Meet at the Harvard Weld Boathouse on the corner of JFK and Memorial Drive between noon and 12:15 – look for the herb walk sign! We’ll leave promptly at 12:15, and return by 1:15. Feel free to bring a notebook or sketchbook, camera, etc. The fee for the herb walk is $5.

Herb walks are “Sprinkle or Shine!” – if it’s just damp or a bit drizzly, we’ll walk anyway. If it’s raining enough to need an umbrella, that makes it hard to learn, so we will cancel in that event.
 

Interested in having us come and do an herb walk somewhere in particular? Let us know!
results.name: Herb Walk at Charles River

results.description:
We need to get the following information into the hands of EVERY DIRECTOR of a KILL SHELTER in the US as well as BOARD MEMBERS and supporters of those shelters.   Due to a generous grant from a supporter, the NO KILL ADVOCACY CENTER (not to be confused w/organizations with similar names) is making the following offer. We need YOUR HELP! Please post to the Facebook page of EVERY KILL "Shelter" you can think of- as well as every pro-animal group.  Please also email info to shelter directors & board members of Kill "shelters" (contact info below).   Please make it clear that you are NOT a member of any group but are writing as a private citizen.   IMPORTANT:  Always be extremely polite & assume they will stop the killing once they understand how it can be done.

We CAN SEE a NO KILL AMERICA in our lifetimes!
---

FREE to a GOOD (or bad) SHELTER

Are you a SHELTER DIRECTOR? Attorney Nathan Winograd, former Director of Operations for the SF SPCA and Director of the No Kill Advocacy Center, would like to show you- FREE - how ANY SHELTER can become NO KILL - while TURNING A HEFTY PROFIT! For your FREE COPY of the book "REDEMPTION- the No Kill Revolution in America" as well as a your FREE CD with over 200 documents, including “how to” guides, sample policies and procedures that will guide you, step by step, in implementing this proven model, please send a letter on official letterhead to:

No Kill Advocacy Center
6114 La Salle Ave. #837
Oakland CA 94611

The fine print: No emails. U.S. addresses only. Only one per shelter. Under the terms of the grant, this offer does not apply to foster-based rescue groups. While supplies last. For a schedule of screenings of documentary film REDEMPTION: The No Kill Revolution in America (based on the book), please go to www.nokill.org

Note:  (copied from original discussion on August's "virtual event"): a list of the 10 highest kill shelters is available here:   http://www.advocateforsavingdogs.org/highkillshelterslist.html

I posted on lots of sites and wrote the director of a shelter in Augusta, GA - will continue on down the list. I think it might be good strategy, though, to start with the shelters in your town and then state. You go to webpages to find staff members and mail them. I would cc several people at a shelter- my logic being that maybe *one* will be receptive. We can also email members on the boards of directors

PLEASE:  remember to be extremely polite, and always assume the directors are just not aware of the no-kill model and would certainly implement it if they knew how.

IMPORTANT:  Please make it clear that you are writing as a private citizen, and not as part of an organized effort

For more discussion on which states have been covered, etc, please see original discussion at august's virtual "save lives" event.

WE CAN DO THIS!

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill 
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street 
Mission Hill, Roxbury 
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops) 
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer, 
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2). 

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).


We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm or so (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Use the T - #66 bus comes by - E-Line or Orange Line

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.
TALK with us FIRST !!
Looking for Gifted Marketers to
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?

Portion Control

Bake...Don't Fry!

Roasted Veggie Stackers

No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream

Avocados!!!

Salad with Chipotle Hummus

Simple Cilantro Chutney

More $2 bags of Produce!

Drink your greens!

results.description:
I believe that Season 1 of the Electric Lunch League is winding down, and recruiting is beginning for Season 2. Assuming both Season 1 games are done by the time this event closes, we'll kick off Season 2 at that point.

For the uninitiated, the Electric Lunch League is an online competition in the spirit of the EBL et al, devoted to the play of the (very very good) new Splotter Spellen game Food Chain Magnate. No experience with the game is required though it is strongly recommended that you give the rules a decent once-over before diving in. (Also, don't expect to win your first time out; your first game is likely to be a Learning Experience unless you're competing against equally inexperienced players. Fortunately, at this point, nobody has all that much FCM experience!)

For the newcomers:

The game length of Food Chain Magnate is variable (by design) but my online games have typically lasted 1 to 2 weeks if people are paying attention.

Please note that the boardgamecore site DOES NOT send e-mail notifications if it is your turn. If you sign up for the ELL we do ask that you help out your fellow players by checking on the status of your game a minimum of at least once or twice during the day if at all possible.

There may also be occasional bugs in the boardgamecore system; please try to maintain a sense of humor about interface problems.
results.name: Electric Lunch League (Online Food Chain Magnate), Season 2

results.description:
Our Happy Hours are targeted towards entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and people looking to network with Coalition members. We have all sorts of beers, chips, dip, and N64 games! We would love to meet you, have a conversation, play some Mario Kart, or just have a laugh! :]


Coalition: Boston

 is a flexible office and coworking hub for small businesses and startups. Located in the center of Downtown Boston, we are a strong, close-knit community of entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals who love to celebrate Hump Day on Wednesdays.


Thank you to our Annual Sponsor, Botkeeper!

Botkeeper does everything a bookkeeper can do, only faster, 24/7, with more reporting, beautiful dashboards, and at a fraction of the cost. With the use of software and machine learning, botkeeper automates much of the day to day data entry, classification, and aggregation of information into reports and dashboards. Unlike a traditional bookkeeper, botkeeper is continuously improving and becoming more efficient over time, leading to amazing scalability and big savings for our clients. Knowing it is impossible to automate everything, all botkeeper clients are paired with a dedicated botkeeper CPA to provide a personal touch, advice, and quality assurance. 


FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

You must present an ID to security to gain access to the building. 21+ event.  

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

We are located right above the Downtown Crossing T stop, part of the Red and Orange lines, and one stop away from the Green line at Park Street. Garage parking options can be found here: www.coalitionspace.com/parking 


Can I bring a friend?

We'd be dissapointed if you didn't. But if you don't have any friends, you can make some here! :)


What if I have a nut allergy?

We have Klondike bars!


What's the deal with airline food?

You'll have to ask Jerry Seinfeld.

Share this event on 

Facebook

 and 

Twitter

We hope you can make it!

Cheers,


Coalition: Boston

All are welcome! RSVP @ https://www.eventbrite.com/e/coalitions-happy-hour-sponsored-by-botkeeper-tickets-24355850003?ref=enivtefor001&invite=OTkwMTg4My9ib3N0b25hZG1pbkBjb2FsaXRpb25zcGFjZS5jb20vMA%3D%3D&utm_source=eb_em...
results.how_to_find_us: Enter 101 Arch Street, go to the second floor security desk and present an ID. Then, take one of the first four elevators to the 19th floor.
results.name: Coalition's Happy Hour sponsored by Botkeeper!

results.description:
We walk 5.8 mi. starting out on the Minuteman Bike Trail. Then loop our way through the Lower Vine Brook, North Street, Willard's Woods, Chiesa Farm & Parker Meadow Conservation Areas, before ending back on the bike trail. This is Route A on the new ACROSS Lexington Trails.

ACROSS Lexington (Accessing Conservation land, Recreation areas, Open space, Schools and Streets in Lexington) is a network of pedestrian and bicycle routes that links many parts of the Town of Lexington

ACROSS Lexington routes use various existing public ways, including conservation land trails and sidewalks. Routes connect the center of town with various locations in the town including historic sites, schools and conservation areas. Routes are accessible by foot or bicycle. 

Creating such a network of marked routes is intended to encourage greater utilization of Lexington’s open-space resources for passive recreation. Residents and visitors alike will find enjoyment, exercise and an incentive to travel about town without a car.

The Fine Print:

There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites. 

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

Any time estimate given by an Event Organizer is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time.

This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain or extreme temperature cancels. 

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

 Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you. 

By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below: 
Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in my tan Chevy Impala on right in paking lot
results.name: Across Lexington Trail

results.description:
This is our first time trying this…the plan is to meet for a social hour at the Burren at 5:30, and we will head over to the Rosebud for our "normal" discussion at 7pm.

Our group has been fortunate to grow quite large. But this can make it increasingly difficult to get to know other members/regulars in the group, as not everyone can sit at the same table. 

No RSVP limit for the happy hour. So, come, all who are able, and join us for a drink or an app before the discussion.
results.how_to_find_us: We will plan to be in the front room/bar. Please ask a Burren employee if you can't locate us.
results.name: Wednesday Night Happy Hour

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: Clarendon street entrance. Ask the desk attendant for directions to room.
results.name: Attend a free meeting as a guest and consider joining!

results.description:
DEMOLITION
Synopsis:

Davis (Jake Gyllenhaal), a successful investment banker, struggles after losing his wife in a tragic car crash. Despite pressure from his father in law Phil (Chris Cooper) to pull it together, Davis continues to unravel. What starts as a complaint letter to a vending machine company turns into a series of letters revealing startling personal admissions. Davis’ letters catch the attention of customer service rep Karen (Naomi Watts) and, amidst emotional and financial burdens of her own, the two form an unlikely connection. With the help of Karen and her son Chris (Judah Lewis), Davis starts to rebuild, beginning with the demolition of the life he once knew.


https://youtu.be/3UnSXelOJo0
results.name: Demolition     4-6  Wed.      AMC  7 PM

results.description:
Today’s digitally engaged customers are continually bombarded with offers, recommendations, and advice. But all too frequently, this cacophony of riches becomes a chaotic stream of disparate content resources.

The door opens at 5:30 with food that's better than pizza, and the panel starts at 6.


Come for an interactive conversation about the current challenges of content marketing: overcoming information overload. Explore three critical questions driving contemporary content strategies:

·  How should content marketers channel the chaos of too much content being readily available?

·  How do mobile devices together with untethered business contexts shift the calculations for delivering just-in-time information?

·  When is personalization a good solution for focusing attention on productive digital experiences?

Hear from SAMI panelists about technologies and tactics that help channel content floods and transform them into productive streams. Leave with insights about the business value of content and knowing when there are going to be positive returns on investments.

 The panel will be led by analyst/writer Geoff Bock. Geoff is principal of Bock & Company, focuses on digital strategies for content and enterprise mobility. In his 20-year career as an industry analyst, Geoff has systematically tracked how content technologies power digital experiences and generate added business value. An experienced speaker and panel moderator, Geoff asks the probing questions that stimulate conversation, insights, and learning about the immediate topics at hand.


Donna Shaw is an experienced product leader and most recently was Vice President of Products at Crescendo Content Marketing. She has been focusing on bringing solutions to market that help organizations get the most out of their content marketing strategies. Donna has over 20 years experience in product marketing, in both large companies such as IBM and Microsoft as well as small companies such as Groove Networks and Axceler.

Dan Towvim is Senior Director, eCommerce at Sonesta Hotels where he runs digital marketing and eCommerce for Sonesta, a global hotel chain with over 65 hotels worldwide. Dan has 20 years of experience building consumer and entertainment brands while driving growth through cross-channel customer acquisition and retention. His experience ranges from early-stage startups, to Fortune 100 companies in industries from automotive and entertainment, to education and healthcare.

Andy Zimmerman is Evergage’s Chief Marketing Officer. Before that he was CMO at Brainshark. Before becoming CMO at Brainshark, Andy held various VP positions overseeing Product Marketing, Business Development and Channel Sales there, and led the launch of the SlideShark and myBrainshark product lines. He has more than 20 years of experience helping software companies launch products, drive demand, improve sales productivity and develop high-impact content marketing programs.
results.name: Successful Content Marketing in the Age of Information Overload

results.description:
Hello Hardwarians! 

We're back with another round of companies for you!

It's all about the teams, so each month we have 3 hardware startups present. They have time to pitch, take questions, and demo.  This month's meetup will be located at Bolt in Downtown Crossing.

Note: The Boston Hardware Workshop is occurring April 7th and 8th. This meetup has a lower RSVP limit than usual as we've reserved some spots for workshop attendees who are coming in from out of town. 

Sponsor

Ineda Systems, ENABLING IoT REVOLUTION with smart sensing, Hierarchical computing and trusted securityInnovative and differentiated SoC for IoT and Wearable applications scale performance, power and resources to meet workload needs. Ineda’s SoCs are built on a powerful new   Hierarchical Computing Architecture (HCA) that is aimed at extending the battery life while allowing the sensor hub to be in the always sensing condition to support contextual computing. This HCA allows multiple CPUs to run independently while sharing the onboard resources to offer a unified application experience to the user. It enables optimal use of CPUs, peripherals, accelerators and memory banks based on use case. Optimal use of resources along with sophisticated on-chip power management leads to a power-efficient performance.  Ineda also offers an enhanced trusted environment both at the H/W and S/W level.  Learn more at Inedasystems.com


Format

6.00P: Arrival, food, drinks

6.30P: A word from our sponsor: Ineda Systems

6.40P: Presenter #1: Lift Up


6:55P: Presenter #2: Ray

7:10P: Presenter #3: Kuvee

8.00P: Kick you all out

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Boston Hardware Startup Meetup #28

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street

results.description:
Topic: SQL Server for the IT Pro

Presenter: Burt King

Burt King is Senior Database Administrator at enservio, the makers of ContentsExpress™, the insurance industry’s leading content management system. Burt has more than 15 years experience with SQL Server and specializes in highly available systems utilizing Microsoft technologies such as Windows Clustering and SQL Server Availability Groups.

Burt will be presenting, "The two things you must know about SQL Server to support it and the four other things that help."  This discussion is focused on taking someone with no experience and setting them on the path to being able to competently support Microsoft SQL Server."

Directions:  Please come to the main entrance of 1 Cambridge Center, located at the corner of Broadway and Main streets.  Proceed to the second floor and check in with reception.  You will be directed to the elevators towards the back of the space.  Go to the fourth floor.

Parking:  Meters don’t require payments past 8pm.  Meters have a 2 hour limit, so if you can find a meter around 6pm you'll be good for the night.  There are several pay lots including Standard Parking at 1 Broadway Street or the Marriot parking lot.  The MIT lots are NOT free, and while many people park there the school reserves the right to tow and ticket.

See the section at the bottom of the page titled

"Parking at MIT without a Permit".
http://web.mit.edu/facilities/transportation/parking/visitors/public_parking.html

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~
results.how_to_find_us: Will meet at 6:30 PM at the cubbies by the stairs

results.description:
HIIT is a training technique in which you give 100% effort through quick, intense bursts of exercise, followed by short, and sometimes active recovery. You will burn more fat and calories in the 24 hours after a HIIT workout than you do after a steady-pace run.

Weight loss studies have shown that both weight training and HIIT workouts allow you to preserve hard-earned muscle while ensuring most of the weight lost comes from fat stores. It also stimulates the production of your human growth hormone (HGH) which not only increases your metabolism but slows the aging process.


Stop by the studio every Monday at 6:30 p.m. and get your HIIT on!!

Instructor:  Certified Personal Trainer  - Domenic or Stephan


Class Limit:  15

545 Main Street, Reading, MA 01867

results.description:
Are you separated, divorced, considering divorce, or in the process of divorce?


You are invited to a Divorce Open House Mix & Mingle. Please join us for an evening hosted by our divorce professionals in the fields of law, real estate, parenting, finances, nutrition, relationship coaching, career coaching, therapy, accounting, interior design and more. You will have a chance to meet others in the same situation, as well as speak individually with our divorce professionals, in a friendly and casual setting with complimentary drinks and appetizers.

As a group of experienced professionals, we understand the complexities of divorce and separation and the need for a holistic approach to make the process smoother for everyone. We provide important resources that can help to educate and empower you throughout the process. This evening is intended to provide one-on-one interactions in an informal environment with experts in various fields at no cost. Bring your curiosity, questions, or concerns! 

This is a joint event with other meetup groups. There is no charge for attendance, and discussions with professionals are kept confidential. The event starts at 6:30 p.m., but feel welcome to come anytime between 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. You will be able to go in and out at your convenience. 

Complimentary light bites, wine and other refreshments will be provided for your enjoyment throughout the event.
