results.description:
Note:  Pose will be the same as the Friday 4-hour sessions, so if you want to get a REALLY long pose, sign up for both.  

Jeremy Durling will host- Jeremy's paintings are available through the Sloane Merrill Gallery on Charles Street in Boston.  

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $70, non-members for $90.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $20 (members) or $30 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $70 or $90 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of Central Street and Vernon Street, big brick building.  Park on Vernon street in front of building or in lot behind building.
results.name: Saturday morning painting FIVE-week pose

results.description:
Organizer: Steve Blum[masked]


=========================

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event. Sometimes the questions won't show up if you use a phone or tablet to RSVP so use a computer. 

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself as well as others at risk so consider this before you decide to participate. Contact me if you have any questions. 

=========================

What We're Doing...

The plan is to climb three of the NH 4,000 Footers - Mt. Willey, Mt. Field and Mt. Tom. We will meet in the parking lot of the AMC Highland Ctr. off Rt. 302 in Bretton Woods since the hike will finish there.  We will then drive the needed number of vehicles to the trailhead of the Ethan Pond Trail, several miles East on Rt. 302.


We will follow the Ethan Pond Trail, to the Willey Range Trail to cross the  summits of Mts. Willey and Field.  Then, we will continue Northwesterly on the Willey Range Trail to its terminus at the A-Z Trail, where we will access the spur trail to Mt. Tom.  We will descend the A-Z Trail back to the Highland Center.


Since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety you will need to become self-reliant by learning about the route and potential hazards. Use this link for more information about the summits and trails:

http://newenglandtrailconditions.com/peaks/nhmtwilley.php</a>


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

<a href="http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.1837&lon=-71.4215#.Vvg14Xq2GSo">http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.1837&lon=-71.4215#.Vvg14Xq2GSo

Guests are not permitted - all participants must be members of the group.


Dogs are not permitted due to the steepness of the Willey Range Trail, and the possibility of significant ice.


Trip Summary...

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 8.7 miles and climb 3,786 feet. It should take an average hiker about 6 hours and a quarter hours complete this trip, plus rest times. This event is considered to be INTERMEDIATE because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

What to Bring...

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:

http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

It will still likely be winter in the Whites and I am expecting microspikes (Hillsounds or Katoolahs) to be necessary.  Full crampons may possibly be needed, but more on that later as we see how the weather and temperatures evolve.


Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

Directions...


We will meet IN THE PARKING LOT of the AMC Highland Ctr. Bretton Woods as mentioned above and drive to our start. 

Use this link for customizable driving directions...just replace Boston with your starting location.


https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Boston,+MA/AMC+Highland+Center+at+Crawford+Notch,+U.S.+302,+Carroll,+NH/@43.3102315,-72.3608498,8z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m13!4m12!1m5!1m1!1s0x89e3652d0d3d311b:0x787cbf240162e8a0!2m2!1d-71.0588801!2d42.3600825!1m5!1m1!1s0x4cb38600783fffff:0xf487b8cd7029345f!2m2!1d-71.4120588!2d44.2200456


While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride. If you do share a ride be sure to share the expenses (gas and tolls).

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer...

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
results.name: NH4K ...Mts. Willey (4285'), Field (4340') and Tom (4051')  INTERMEDIATE

results.description:
Come to the Appalachian Mountain Club Bike Repair and Information Workshop to improve your bike knowledge and ride preparedness! It is worthwhile for both new and experienced riders wanting more information and more confidence on the road and trail. RSVP'ing in Meetup does not register you; please click the link below to actually register for the workshop!

To register: 

http://www.amcboston.org/bicycle/workshop/reg.php

Registered in Advance Prices are:

AMC Member Adult/Youth: $30/$20,

Non-Member Adult/Youth: $40/$30
Or $45 at the door for all, advance registration is recommended.

For more information: http://amcboston.org/bicycle/workshop.php

For additional information, contact Valerie Paul ([masked],[masked] before 9:00PM).

Workshop subjects covered include:

·  Types of bikes

·  Maintenance

·  Clothing & equipment

·  Riding technique

Concepts and repairs will be discussed and demonstrated at four stations: basic bike, general maintenance, flat tires, and brakes and derailleurs. Attend all four stations. Receive an extensive handout to take home. During lunch discuss with the instructors topics such as touring, safety, bike accessories, bike clothing, what to carry with you on a ride, finding bike routes, and where to shop.
results.name: Bike Repair & Information Workshop

results.description:
Every Saturday morning at 10:00 AM we gather for a fun, calming group run at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. Both walkers and runners are welcome. Our main goal is to socialize and support one another!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 AM and Thursday evenings at 6:30 PM. We first gather in front of the Cleveland Circle Starbucks, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there!

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We will start gathering outside the Starbucks at Cleveland Circle around 9:45am... see you then!
results.name: Saturday's Group Fun Run

results.description:
The annual Mission Hill Community Health Fair on Saturday,
April 9, from 11 am to 3 pm, needs staffers for the Fair Foods TABLE because Fair Foods is so busy with their own several bagging and distribution operations at other sites.

What will be involved is unloading produce from a truck and bagging 4 items rather than 7-10 items in the bags.

Instead of taking cash, we'll be handing out FREE bags and telling people about the 6 Fair Foods locations in and around Mission Hill.

So we want volunteers who are succinct, articulate, healthy and presentable, and hard-working - able to project a 'let's get healthy' image for Fair Foods and for the event host, Mission Hill Health Movement.

Mission Hill residents are a diverse crowd over over 15,000, but about 1/3 of those residents are undergraduates and others related to the college, professional school, and institutional learning environments surrounding the Mission Hill neighborhood of Roxbury.
results.name: Fair Foods TABLE at Mission Hill Community Health Fair

results.description:
Mark your calendars!  It's not often that we have the honor of welcoming Body & Brain's Regional Director, Master Cho.  It's truly something special to have the privilege of experiencing his training & to learn from his great wisdom.  I guarantee you will walk away with some great information that you will be able to implement immediately ;)

Master Cho will be training on the "Life Particle Effect" to empower us with the knowledge & ability to create positive change.  Whether you joined us recently for our Life Particle movie or not, it does not matter - all are welcome to attend this FREE event.  No prior knowledge or experience is necessary, only the desire to create a better life for yourself & for the world around you!

"Everything that exists in the Universe is composed of Life Particles.  These particles vibrate with endless possibilities, responding to our intentions & choices."  Learn how to positively affect these particles to change your life for the better!

Please RSVP to confirm your spot and export to your calendar as a reminder :)
results.how_to_find_us: located behind Coffee Cann Cafe - plenty of free parking
results.name: Special Event - FREE Training with Master Cho!

results.description:
Please make sure to RSVP at this meetup event and checkin when you come in for the run.

Group run logistics: Please come prepared for a short run (or run/walk). Leave your bags, etc. at home or in your car so that you can run easily. Please make sure to arrive 10 minutes early to look for parking, find the location, etc.  


Coach will brief you at the beginning of the run about the distance (about 2.5 miles) and direct you through stretching exercises. It is absolutely OK to run/walk in the beginning. Many of us are first-time runners. So please don’t be shy :-). 

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.  We offer referral discounts for fundraising targets.

Program overview:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for Association for India's Development and Asha for Education. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session you can get more details of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group of runners and volunteers
results.name: Beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training run

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
